description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Word of the Day: loquacious
Spelling Bee Forum
description: FRIDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Female Entrepreneurs Who Confront a Particular Kind of Troll
description: Fly By Jing, an artisanal food business in Los Angeles, is known for its Sichuan chili crisp and good-humored online presence.

title: Catch up on the latest news on Ukraine.
description: Russian troops in southeastern Ukraine have seized Europes largest nuclear power plant, Ukrainian officials said on Friday, but a fire there that had raised worldwide alarms was extinguished. There had been worries that the fire could spread to nuclear reactors and lead to radiation leaks, but international monitors said Friday morning that there was no immediate sign that radiation had leaked during the battle for the plant.

title: The Brilliant Alchemy of Rick Owens
description: PARIS  A few months ago, when the designer Rick Owens started thinking about his fall collection, he was thinking about Covid and the re-emergence, and discos, and parties, and whether all of that was good or bad, and how he had mixed feelings, and so on and so forth. Sound familiar? But then last week happened, and everything changed.

title: 5 Things to Do This Weekend
description: Selections from the current Weekend section, including a review of The Batman.

title: Nixons Tricks, Antarctic Expeditions and Other Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Literary Allusions
description: The comic above, which weve borrowed from The New York Times Book Review,  was headlined there, Day Jobs: What your favorite writers might have done if they hadnt written.

title: How Emotionally Intelligent Are You?
description: Do you consider yourself emotionally intelligent? In other words, are you able to identify and acknowledge feelings in yourself or others? How important do you think it is to be able to do that?

title: How Stacey Abrams Thinks About Business
description: Stacey Abrams is best known as a champion for voting rights and a rising star in the Democratic Party.

title: Who Should Be Allowed to Transition?
description: Two and a half years ago, I sat in a medical waiting room nervously rehearsing my reason for seeing the nurse practitioner. The words I needed to say to her  that I was transgender and wanted her help medically transitioning  I had once promised myself not to say to anyone. I thought Id keep this part of my identity my deepest secret, one Id known since childhood but would never reveal.

title: The New York Times News Quiz, March 4, 2022
description: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

title: Get Out of Your Pajamas, the Pandemic Is Over*
description: For the past several weeks, mayor Eric Adams has been exhorting businesses to get their employees back in the office, first making an appeal to conscience and then to cultural personality. Without a steady flow of commercial traffic, delis, restaurants, dry cleaners and all the remaining places that mix poke bowls while you wait on line will disappear, he has argued, endangering the livelihoods of hourly wage workers.

title: Fareed Zakaria Has a Better Way to Handle Russia  and China
description: Russias utterly unprovoked, unjustifiable, immoral invasion of Ukraine would seem to mark the end of an era, writes Fareed Zakaria, one that began with the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989.

title: What Kind of Story Will Ketanji Brown Jackson Tell Her Fellow Justices?
description: In 1992, months after Justice Thurgood Marshall retired from the Supreme Court, Justice Sandra Day OConnor published an appreciative essay in the Stanford Law Review titled The Influence of a Raconteur.

title: Boiling Oil, Red-Hot Irons, 26-Second Amputations: How Surgery Evolved
description: EMPIRE OF THE SCALPEL: The History of Surgery, by Ira Rutkow

title: What Will Our Covid Future Be Like? Here Are Two Signs to Look Out For.
description: Omicron cases, hospitalizations and deaths have been substantially declining across the United States for more than a month. In response, governors and mayors are rolling back restrictions like mask mandates and vaccine passports. Many wonder whether this period of low cases and decreasing demands on hospitals is a turning point in the pandemic or is simply a lull before a new variant causes another dangerous surge.

title: Lesson of the Day: Meet Peat, the Unsung Hero of Carbon Capture
description: This lesson is a part of our Accessible Activities feature, which aims to welcome a wider variety of learners to our site and to The Times. Learn more and tell us what you think here.

title: Ive Dealt With Foreign Cyberattacks. America Isnt Ready for Whats Coming.
description: As Russian missiles rain on Ukraine, theres another battle brewing  in the cybersphere. Destructive malware has flooded hundreds of Ukrainian websites and computers since Vladimir Putin announced his invasion. It would be a mistake to assume such attacks will remain limited to Ukrainian targets.

title: Dueling Messages Muddle Bidens Agenda on Guns
description: WASHINGTON  In late January, days before President Biden reiterated a vow to halt the sale of parts used to make deadly ghost guns, the federal official responsible for enacting that policy delivered a far more reassuring message to the gun industry.

title: Skater Beatrice Domond Makes a Splash
description: Name: Beatrice Domond

title: Meet the Athlete Challenging Ideas About What Is Possible
description: Climbing and skiing Denali in Alaska, elevation 20,310 feet, is grueling. Mountaineers endure blizzards, high altitude and weeks in subzero temperatures as they slowly make their way up the highest peak in North America. Vasu Sojitra did it on one leg.

title: The Native American Bohemia in Brownstone Brooklyn
description: On a quiet street in the Boerum Hill neighborhood of Brooklyn, theres an unassuming yellow-brick house that once served as an unofficial community center for Native Americans in show business. The theater director Muriel Miguel grew up there, and lives there still. When she was a child, in the 1930s and 40s, Native dancers and actors from all around the country would stop by the house while working in New York. Some would stick around for months, or even years.

title: Economic Ties Among Nations Spur Peace. Or Do They?
description: Russias war in Ukraine is not only reshaping the strategic and political order in Europe, it is also upending long-held assumptions about the intricate connections that are a signature of the global economy.

title: The Starrett-Lehigh Building, at 90, Prepares for Its Future
description: When the gargantuan Starrett-Lehigh Building went up in West Chelsea in 1931, it was quickly hailed as a masterwork of industrial modernism, a triumph both of engineering and of International Style architectural aesthetics.

title: Why Dont All Lions Climb Trees?
description: Visit Queen Elizabeth National Park in Uganda or Lake Manyara National Park in Tanzania and youll see something unusual: lions that climb trees and spend a good part of their lives resting on branches high above the ground. Elsewhere, lions rarely climb and look rather silly when they try to do so.

title: The Fight Over Maus Is Part of a Bigger Cultural Battle in Tennessee
description: ATHENS, Tenn.  After the McMinn County School Board voted in January to remove Maus, a graphic novel about the Holocaust, from its eighth-grade curriculum, the community quickly found itself at the center of a national frenzy over book censorship.

title: Biden Says Fund the Police. Well, They Arent Exactly Hurting for Cash.
description: We should all agree, President Biden declared in his State of the Union address on Tuesday:

title: A Day in the Life of an Agent
description: The real estate industry is drawing workers while nearly every other sector has struggled to do so.

title: He Break Dances. He Pole Dances. He Sings Like an Angel.
description: LONDON  When foreign stars visit the Glyndebourne opera festival in the countryside outside London, its common for them to participate in some time-honored English rituals, like sipping Pimms on the lawn or nibbling on a scone for afternoon tea. But when the young Polish countertenor Jakub Jozef Orlinski arrived to perform the title role in Handels Rinaldo in 2019, he announced his presence differently: by break dancing on the terrace in front of an audience in ball gowns and tuxedos, as well as a photographer or two.

title: Yes, Your Pets Can Also Put On Pandemic Pounds
description: It had been a year since Henrys last haircut, and Michelle Holbrook did not realize that her 7-pound, goofy toy poodle was now almost 9 pounds. His cute, shaggy look not only obscured his weight, it also made it harder for the Holbrooks to resist his begging.

title: Why So Many People Became Real Estate Agents in the Pandemic
description: In March 2020 when the pandemic hit, the restaurant where Amy Bieganek was working as a waitress announced a temporary closure. By August, it turned into a permanent one.

title: In a Run-Down Roman Villa, a Princess From Texas Awaits Her Next Act
description: ROME  Princess Rita Boncompagni Ludovisi wasted no time in pointing out the selling points of her home, the Villa Aurora, a 16th-century estate, smack in the center of Rome, loaded with masterpiece paintings, historical archives and noble family lore.

title: How a Boutique-Fragrance Expert Spends Her Sundays
description: Kimberly Waters is the founder of Muse: Modern Urban Sensory Experiences, a niche fragrance business that she runs out of her home on the weekends. A visit to Muse is by appointment only and includes cocktails and snacks. The main event is a guided tour of Ms. Waterss curated perfume collection, with bottles available for purchase.

title: Sony and Honda Announce Tie-Up to Make Electric Cars
description: TOKYO  The Japanese electronics and entertainment giant Sony announced on Friday that it would team up with Honda to develop electric cars for sale as early as 2025, becoming the latest company to throw its hat into the burgeoning market for battery-powered vehicles.

title: China Turns Away from the World Under Xi and How to Talk to Kids About Ukraine: The Week in Narrated Articles
description: This weekend, listen to a collection of narrated articles from around The New York Times, read aloud by the reporters who wrote them.

title: Remote work is changing how climbing the career ladder works.
description: Remote work is often favored by established employees who know their manager, are comfortable in their role and want to balance work with family responsibilities or other personal obligations. For those just starting their careers, working in isolation can make fitting into an organization  and eventually progressing up its ranks  more difficult.

title: Strong Job Growth Continues as Latest Covid Wave Eases
description: Falling coronavirus caseloads brought a flood of new jobs and new workers last month, signs that the pandemics vise grip on the economy may be loosening.

title: How China Embraces Russian Propaganda and Its Version of the War
description: Hours after Russia invaded Ukraine on Feb. 24, the Chinese Communist Party tabloid, Global Times, posted a video saying that a large number of Ukrainian soldiers had laid down their arms. Its source: the Russian state-controlled television network, RT.

title: Who Doesnt Need a Portable Fog Machine?
description: Theres a lot to see at fashion week. Blink (or scroll too fast) and youll miss the details: feathered bags, futuristic sunglasses, fork jewelry. All month long, well spotlight the things we saw that surprised or delighted us.

title: The Death of the Competitive Congressional District
description: This episode contains strong language.

title: Fire at a Ukrainian nuclear plant is out, but Russian troops take control of the site.
description: LVIV, Ukraine  Russian troops seized control of Europes largest nuclear power plant in southeastern Ukrainebefore dawn on Friday, according to Ukrainian officials, but a fire set off by a raging gun battle had been extinguished. The fighting and fire had raised worldwide alarm because of the potential that they could reach and damage the nuclear reactors and cause a radiation leak.

title: Russias Brutal Advance
description: The war in Ukraine is a mismatch.

title: How Thom Browne Turned the Gray Flannel Suit Into Something Subversive
description: NEW YORK IS a city lived out in the open, a place where, pandemic or not, you see people in captivating outfits every day. But two decades after the 56-year-old American fashion designer Thom Browne established his line, its still startling to see someone wearing one of his suits out in the wild. These devotees typically adhere to Brownes proportional dictates for his signature shrunken 1950s-inspired tailoring: The trousers should be hemmed short, rising two or three inches above sockless black leather brogues; their cuffs should likewise approach three inches. The matching three-button jacket, cut high in the armholes  both broadening the shoulders and discouraging bad posture  should be fastened only once, snugly around the rib cage, from which the blazer should skim six inches over the pants waist. Its truncated sleeves should reveal an inch of white shirt cuffs underneath, and dont forget the white pocket square, which should be ironed, and stick out only one-third inch, as one guide published by the brand explains.

title: How Bad Is Inflation, Really?
description: This morning, the Labor Department will report how many jobs employers added to their payrolls in February. Economists expect a healthy gain. (For full coverage of the report, see The Timess special briefing, which will be updated throughout the day.)

title: Stocks slide as concern about Ukraine trumps the strong jobs report.
description: Stocks tumbled on Friday, with European indexes reaching their lowest point in about a year, as fighting intensified in Ukraine and government officials accused Russia of shelling Europes largest nuclear power facility, starting a fire that was later extinguished.

title: Why Your Boss Wants to Know Your Love Language
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: ISIS Claims Bombing of Pakistani Mosque, Killing Dozens
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  A bomb tore through a Shiite mosque in Peshawar, in northwestern Pakistan, on Friday, killing at least 57 people and wounding more than 100 in one of the worst terrorist attacks in Pakistan in several years.

title: A Snake-Inspired Bracelet Watch Evolves Once More
description: Bulgaris Serpenti totem has assumed many forms in the 74 years since its debut in postwar Italy. The jewelers earliest snake-inspired pieces tended toward abstraction, referencing ophidian sinuousness by way of a corrugated gold bracelet  based on the articulated flex of gas piping  that slithered up the wrist. More recent designs, such as gem-wreathed watch faces shaped like a venomous snakes triangular head, have mimicked the creatures slinky form more directly. But it is the Italian houses bold creations from the 1950s and 60s, those with the most recognizably reptilian features, that have influenced its newest collection of womens timepieces.

title: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Fareed Zakaria
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode with Fareed Zakaria. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: How Scarves Became a Staple in Soccer Culture
description: This is Clued In, a column that will give you insight into some of the New York Times Crossword clues and answers.

title: Consumer Agency Weighs Ban on Medical Debts in Credit Reports
description: Unpaid medical bills became a bigger concern during the pandemic, and now, a federal consumer agency is considering whether those debts should be banned from consumer credit reports.

title: Surrounded by Big Tech, Small Podcast Shops Swim With Sharks
description: Last August, Leon Neyfakh had a decision to make. Prologue Projects, his podcast production company, was working on the fifth season of Fiasco, a narrative nonfiction show about American scandals in living memory. Earlier seasons of the show had won acclaim for their immersive re-interrogations of twisty political conflicts  Bush v. Gore, Iran Contra, Boston school desegregation  and Neyfakh felt confident in the idea for the new season, which would follow the early years of the AIDS crisis. What he didnt yet know was how he would pay for it.

title: The Weekender
description: Does microdosing work? Also in this edition: An interview with the stars of a new Elizabeth Holmes series, and the Amazonification of Whole Foods.

title: How to Get the Most Out of Your Dishwasher
description: No, you don't need to pre-rinse.

title: Who Should Get Reparations in California?
description: If California were to provide reparations for Black residents, who exactly should qualify for the payments?

title: To Boycott Russians, or Not? In Film and Beyond, Thats the Question.
description: The Russian filmmaker Kirill Sokolov has spent the past week distraught at the horror unfolding in Ukraine. Half his family is Ukrainian, he said in a telephone interview, and as a child he spent summers there, staying with his grandparents.

title: Tesla Wins Approval to Open European Assembly Plant
description: BERLIN  German authorities gave the approval on Friday for Tesla to begin production of electric vehicles and battery cells at its first major assembly plant in Europe, after months of delays and disputes, paving the way for the electric car company to begin production of its Model Y sport utility vehicle.

title: In These Womens Hands, Dating Is Truly the Stuff of Horror
description: When the comedy screenwriter Lauryn Kahn first tried her hand at horror, a friend told her to write about the thing that scared her the most. She chose dating. After all, whats more terrifying than relying on blind faith and a few Google searches to determine whether a complete stranger is a dud, a narcissist or, worse, a charming sociopath?

title: Decades of Neglect Leave I.R.S. in Tax Season Chaos
description: WASHINGTON  At the Internal Revenue Services sprawling Kansas City, Mo., processing center, teams of clerks earning $15 per hour work through the night, trying to help the agency clear a backlog of more than 20 million tax returns that are a year overdue.

title: Supreme Court Restores Death Sentence for Boston Marathon Bomber
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Friday reinstated the death sentence of Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who was convicted of helping carry out the 2013 Boston Marathon bombings that killed three and injured hundreds more.

title: NATO rejects intervening in Ukraine, including with a no-fly zone.
description: BRUSSELS  NATO foreign ministers rejected any possibility of intervening against Russian forces in Ukraine, whether on the ground or in the air, the alliances secretary general said Friday.

title: Lindsey Graham says of Putin: Someone in Russia should take this guy out.
description: Senator Lindsey Graham, Republican of South Carolina, called on Thursday night for the assassination of President Vladimir V. Putin, saying in a television interview as Russian forces shelled a nuclear power plant in Ukraine that somebody in Russia should step up to the plate and take this guy out.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Good morning. Dorie Greenspan, who has been developing recipes and writing about food for The New York Times Magazine for the past five years, is taking her leave this week, so as to concentrate on her xoxo Dorie newsletter. But I bet well lure her back occasionally, and Im sure well get more delicious recipes from her when we do.

title: Five Horror Movies to Stream Now
description: Max (Booboo Stewart) and Avery (Scarlett Sperduto) spend their flirty date strolling the quiet streets of a small town. A bomb threat has shut down the movie theater where they were planning to catch The Evil Dead, so instead Avery takes Max to the middle of nowhere to explore an old house she says is haunted. There, the two wander upstairs into a furnished bedroom, where Avery surprises Max with a story about Rotcreep, a fiendish entity who she warns is hungry. Like, right now hungry. Talk about leading a guy on.

title: The GoFundMe C.E.O. Wants You to Ask: How Can I Help?
description: When a tornado tears through a rural town, or someone falls ill and cant pay their medical bills, or a local charity needs extra funding, its increasingly common that a GoFundMe page will pop up to raise money.

title: How a War Helped Ease a Rift Between Britain and the E.U.
description: LONDON  It took the invasion of a sovereign nation, the bombardment of its cities and the continents biggest security challenge in decades to make it happen. But for the first time in years, Britain and the European Union are working together again.

title: Russias War Prompts a Pitch for Socially Responsible Military Stocks
description: Russias invasion of Ukraine has upset the world order. It could conceivably alter the way some people think about investing, too.

title: Great Freedom and the Long Shadow of an Anti-Gay Law in Germany
description: BERLIN  A turning point arrives for Viktor and Hans, the central characters in the new film Great Freedom, when Viktor sees the concentration camp tattoo on Hanss arm.

title: Disney+ Will Introduce a Cheaper, Ad-Supported Version This Year
description: Disney+ will soon be available at a reduced price, but youll have to sit through commercials.

title: Monique Hanotte, Savior of Allied Airmen, Dies at 101
description: Monique Hanotte, who greeted border guards as friends as she smuggled about 140 Allied airmen out of German-occupied Belgium during World War II, died on Feb. 20 in Nivelles, Belgium. She was 101.

title: Chinas Slowing Economy Tops Agenda at Legislative Session
description: BEIJING  When Chinas legislature opened its weeklong annual session on Saturday, Chinese leaders were eager to use the event to bolster confidence in the countrys economy.

title: Harry Belafonte Turns 95 With a Call for Social Justice
description: He put his money where his mouth is, and he put his career on the line, said Laurence Fishburne at a gala Tuesday night celebrating the 95th birthday of Harry Belafonte, the groundbreaking entertainer whose fight for racial justice may prove an even more lasting legacy. And he looked pretty while he was doing it.

title: The Buzzy Band Wet Leg Trips Out at a Party, and 13 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: What Putins war could mean for fossil fuels
description: How do you ensure energy security on a hotter planet? Thats the thorny new question that Russias invasion of Ukraine presents to many countries, most immediately in Europe.

title: Review: At the Philharmonic, a Conductor Is the Star
description: Its probably safe to say that Herbert Blomstedt will not be the New York Philharmonics next music director.

title: Russia Takes Censorship to New Extremes, Stifling War Coverage
description: Russia clamped down harder Friday on news and free speech than at any time in President Vladimir V. Putins 22 years in power, blocking access to Facebook and major foreign news outlets, and enacting a law to punish anyone spreading false information about its Ukraine invasion with up to 15 years in prison.

title: Joni James, 91, Heartfelt Chanteuse of the 1950s, Dies
description: Joni James, a best-selling chanteuse whose records climbed the Billboard charts in the 1950s and who was an early influence on Barbra Streisand, died on Feb. 20 in West Palm Beach, Fla. She was 91.

title: We Have No Choice: Mothers in Ukraine Flee to Poland
description: At a station in Western Ukraine, mothers and their children boarded evacuation trains to Poland, while many of their husbands stayed to defend the country from advancing Russian forces.

title: BBC suspends its operations in Russia after a strict censorship law is passed.
description: The BBC said it was temporarily suspending its operations in Russia on Friday after the countrys parliament passed a censorship law that penalizes anyone deemed to be discrediting the Russian military with 15 years in prison.

title: An appeals ruling bars the U.S. from expelling any endangered migrant families on public health grounds.
description: WASHINGTON  The Biden administration can no longer use a public health rule to justify expelling migrant families who cross the border without documentation if doing so would subject them to persecution or torture, according to a federal appeals panel ruling issued on Friday.

title: Wonking Out: Putins Other Big Miscalculation
description: Despite the astonishingly effective fight Ukraine has put up against invading forces, most military experts seem to believe that Russias sheer advantage in firepower will eventually prevail. Having no relevant expertise, I see no reason to question their judgment.

title: Volunteer Hackers Converge on Ukraine Conflict With No One in Charge
description: The hackers came from around the world. They knocked Russian and Ukrainian government websites offline, graffitied antiwar messages onto the home pages of Russian media outlets and leaked data from rival hacking operations. And they swarmed into chat rooms, awaiting new instructions and egging each other on.

title: Letter From Ukraine: Im Not Planning to Leave
description: To the Editor:

title: The Best of Late Night
description: President Bidens State of the Union address provided plenty of talking points for the late-night hosts this week, as did Russias invasion of Ukraine. Here's what they had to say.

title: A Manhattan Chef Heads Upstate. A Country Tavern Follows.
description: PINE PLAINS, N.Y.  Its a fantasy many New Yorkers share: Move upstate, restore an old house, escape the noise of the city. But Clare de Boer, who will open her first solo restaurant, Stissing House, on Thursday, knows this isnt some romantic endeavor.

title: Shane Warne, One of Crickets Masters of Spin, Dies at 52
description: Shane Warne, one of the greatest cricket players of all time, and a larger-than-life figure on and off the field, died Friday in Thailand. He was 52.

title: 2022 Oscar Nominations: Full Ballot
description: See this years Oscar nominees and make your picks.

title: With Sanctions, U.S. and Europe Aim to Punish Putin and Fuel Russian Unrest
description: WASHINGTON  As they impose historic sanctions on Russia, the Biden administration and European governments have set new goals: devastate the Russian economy as punishment for the world to witness, and create domestic pressure on President Vladimir V. Putin to halt his war in Ukraine, current and former U.S. officials say.

title: Winning Time: When the N.B.A. Went Pop
description: When asked to describe the 1980s Los Angeles Lakers, the actor DeVaughn Nixon, 38, paused for a moment. Stylized, he said. Then he rattled off more words: Fast. Cool. Fun. Sexy.

title: The W.N.B.A.s $20 Million Debate Over Leg Room, Luxury and Health
description: The W.N.B.A. said charter flights were too expensive. The players said they did not have to be. The W.N.B.A. commissioner said she wanted them more than anyone. The players said that when they asked for them just two years ago, it felt like the answer was a hard no.

title: Andrei Belgrader, 75, Dies; Director Influenced Future Stars
description: Andrei Belgrader, who directed numerous high-profile stage productions off Broadway and in regional theaters and was an important influence in the careers of John Turturro, Cherry Jones, Tony Shalhoub and other respected actors, died on Feb. 22 in Los Angeles. He was 75.

title: This Time, Beeple Is Trying His Hand at Artwork for Walls
description: A cavalry of crypto enthusiasts funneled into Manhattans TriBeCa neighborhood on Thursday evening, waiting outside Jack Hanley Gallery for a chance to meet their online art messiah in the flesh. In the mix were celebrities like Jimmy Fallon. It was a rock-star welcome for Mike Winkelmann, the digital artist known as Beeple, who was putting the final touches on his images of decapitated tech executives and haywire science experiments.

title: A Musicians Turn to Improvisation Bears Fruit
description: A few years ago, as his 40th birthday loomed, the pianist Eric Wubbels had reasons to be content. He had a steady career as a performer and composer in New York, where he gave frequent concerts with the Wet Ink Ensemble  the celebrated contemporary classical group he had directed with a close crew of collaborators for more than a decade. But he could also see another route for himself, one that led outside the city.

title: A Natural (and Political and Cultural) History of Americas Bird
description: THE BALD EAGLEThe Improbable Journey of Americas BirdBy Jack E. Davis

title: The Fish That Makes Me Want to Cook
description: At the end of another week in this world of ours, I saw an article appear with the headline 19 Extremely Easy Recipes for When Youre Burned Out, written by my wonderful colleague Margaux Laskey. I felt so seen, to use the parlance of our times.

title: Paralympics President Rebukes Russia at Opening Ceremony
description: BEIJING  The president of the International Paralympic Committee broke protocol on Friday when he denounced Russias invasion of Ukraine in his speech at the opening ceremony of the Beijing Games.

title: I Dont Want to Be Called Russian Anymore: Anxious Soviet Diaspora Rethinks Identity
description: LOS ANGELES  Outside Babushka Grandmas deli in the heart of Hollywood, immigrants from Russia, Ukraine and other countries that were part of the former Soviet Union sipped coffee and nibbled on piroshkis during a recent warm, sun-drenched afternoon.

title: N.Y.C. Ends School Mask Mandate and Vaccine Rules for Indoor Venues
description: Mayor Eric Adams of New York announced that the restrictions would end on March 7, a significant step in the citys efforts to return to normalcy after a sharp decline in coronavirus cases.

title: With His Sci-Fi Android, a Filmmaker Considers What It Means to Be Alive
description: Kogonada distinctly remembers the first time the specter of nonexistence dawned upon him. He was alone in his room, and it was a weekend.

title: The War in Ukraine Holds a Warning for the World Order
description: The liberal world order has been on life support for a while. President Biden, in his inaugural address, called democracy fragile. President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia said two years ago that the liberal idea had outlived its purpose, while Chinas leader, Xi Jinping, has extolled the strength of an all-powerful state and, as he put it last March, self-confidence in our system.

title: Love Letter: Her Memory as Role Model
description: My mother was effortlessly cool, Becky Miller writes in this weeks Modern Love essay. Dark sweaters, no makeup, unbrushed yet somehow unruffled hair, the occasional dangly earring, an air of confidence and tranquillity.

title: Capitalizing Black Isnt Wrong. But It Isnt That Helpful, Either.
description: Many people these days, noting my frequent skepticism of the woke vocabulary and woke prescriptions for language use, ask me why Im capitalizing Black when I write about Black Americans.

title: Akaash Singh and His Case for Bringing Back Apu
description: When The Simpsons stopped using the Indian convenience store owner Apu in new episodes, many saw it as a hard-won victory against cultural stereotypes. The Indian American comic Akaash Singh was not one of them. In fact, he was upset about it  and as stand-ups do, he brought that onstage.

title: Ukraine War Forces a Question: How Far East Does Europe Go?
description: BRUSSELS  Ukrainians waved European Union flags when they put their lives on the line in 2014 during their revolution in Maidan Square, in the center of Kyiv, provoked by their desire to draw closer to the West. It was a pivotal moment, choosing Europe over Russia and incurring the Kremlins wrath.

title: Russia blocks Facebook inside the country, as the Kremlin moves to stifle dissent.
description: Facebook on Friday became the first American tech giant to be blocked by the Russian government, as part of the Kremlins broadening campaign to tighten control of the internet and limit spaces for dissent about the war in Ukraine.

title: NATO Accuses Russia of Using Cluster Bombs in Ukraine
description: BRUSSELS  NATO officials, determined to show a unified front of support for Ukraine, on Friday accused Russia of using cluster bombs in its invasion, but rejected Kyivs plea to impose a no-fly zone over Ukrainian airspace, fearing that would draw the military alliance into a larger war with Russia.

title: How a Russian Oligarch Is (Probably) Overvaluing Chelsea
description: Roman Abramovich, who is selling Chelsea, values the club at about $4 billion. Heres why the team is probably not worth anything close to that.

title: Gary North, Apostle of Bible-Based Economics, Dies at 80
description: Gary North, an economic historian who found a wide audience in Americas far right and libertarian movements with his call for a Bible-based economic agenda under a harsh Christian theocracy, died on Feb. 24 in Dallas, Ga. He was 80.

title: I Want Peace. Zelenskys Heroic Resistance Is an Example for the World.
description: As Russias leader holds his ground in his invasion of Ukraine, increasingly isolated from the rest of the world, the leadership of the United States and its European allies becomes ever more essential.

title: Saving Lives, One Call at a Time
description: As part of a weekly series on changes in the workplace for women, were profiling those who stepped up at a moment of crisis and filled gaps in the labor market during the pandemic.

title: Supreme Court Sides With F.B.I. in Case on Spying on Muslims
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Friday unanimously rejected an argument that could have limited the sweep of the state secrets doctrine in a case arising from the surveillance of Muslims in Southern California in 2006.

title: Dan Graham, Mind-Bending Conceptual Artist, Dies at 79
description: Dan Graham, a contrarian polymath best known, despite his protests, as a conceptual artist, died on Feb. 19 in Manhattan. He was 79.

title: In a Moment of Crisis, These Women Went to Work
description: By now, negative headlines about female employment over the past two years tell a familiar story. Many women, who already bore responsibility for the majority of unpaid domestic labor, were forced by the pandemic to retreat from their roles in the professional world.

title: A doctor prominent in fomenting opposition to Covid vaccines pleads guilty to Capitol riot charges.
description: The founder of Americas Frontline Doctors, an activist group known for spreading misinformation and conspiracy theories about the pandemic and Covid vaccines, has pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor charge related to the storming of the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6 last year.

title: No Internet, No Electricity: Life Under Siege in Mariupol
description: Footage verified by The New York Times and interviews with residents point to the growing humanitarian crisis in a key port city in southern Ukraine.

title: Teaching With The New York Times: A Virtual Summit
description: Journalism helps us navigate a complex world, shines a light on the truth, and provides analysis, insight and context to the most pressing issues of our day. These sessions aimed to inspire educators from high school to higher education  and librarians of all kinds  with insight and ideas on the world of journalism and how to make it part of their curriculum and programming.

title: Two New Memoirs About Affliction
description: In 2017, Frank Bruni suffered a stroke while sleeping in the middle of the night, an event that led to blindness in his right eye. His new memoir, The Beauty of Dusk, examines not only his physical condition but the emotional and spiritual counsel he sought from others in order to deal with it. On this weeks podcast, he discusses the experience, including his initial reaction to it.

title: The Books That Shaped Us: A Virtual Times Conversation
description: What are the books that made you see the world a little differently? The books that inspired you or taught you something new? The books that made you  you?

title: As Russia Pounds Ukraine, NATO Countries Rush In Javelins and Stingers
description: NEAR UKRAINES BORDER  Some 14 wide-bodied aircraft transported a bristling array of Javelin antitank missiles, rocket launchers, guns and ammunition to an airfield near Ukraines border on Friday, as the United States and European allies ramped up their efforts to give the Ukrainian military a leg up in battling a foreign enemy that far outguns it.

title: The Artist Who Painted a City
description: Out on the Burley Road, where the last vestiges of the city of Leeds slowly dissolve into the Yorkshire countryside, there is a barn in the middle of a field. It stands there, alone, the size of a garden shed, in a patch of land demarcating the boundary between a pet grooming salon and a dog park.

title: Judge Blocks Effort to Disqualify Cawthorn from Ballot as Insurrectionist
description: WASHINGTON  A judge on Friday blocked a novel electoral challenge that sought to disqualify Representative Madison Cawthorn of North Carolina from running for re-election by labeling him an insurrectionist, issuing an equally novel order that invoked a post-Civil War law that forgave confederate soldiers and sympathizers.

title: Overlooked No More: Barbara Shermund, Flapper-Era Cartoonist
description: This article is part of Overlooked, a series of obituaries about remarkable people whose deaths, beginning in 1851, went unreported in The Times.

title: Review: Raphael Xavier, Breaking Out of Boxes, Barely
description: As the choreographer Rennie Harris established decades ago, the dance language of hip-hop  developed on the streets and in battles  can be as broadly and deeply expressive as any other dance form. He showed that it can be transferred to the stage, and also transformed into metaphor.

title: Luxury giants LVMH and Herms will close stores in Russia temporarily.
description: The French luxury giants LVMH Mot Hennessy Louis Vuitton and Herms each said Friday that they would temporarily close their stores in Russia as the crisis in Ukraine continued to escalate.

title: Changes to N.F.L. Settlement Could Aid Thousands of Black Players Claims
description: The federal judge overseeing the N.F.L. concussion settlement formally removed the use of a race-based method to evaluate dementia tests of Black former players, paving the way for thousands of players to file claims worth potentially hundreds of thousands of dollars.

title: Jealousy Doesnt Have to Ruin a Friendship
description: When Bob Bergesons friend invited him to a Denver Nuggets basketball game with some new pals, he was excited to join in. Sure, the evening would cost him nearly $400, an amount he wouldnt normally spend. But Mr. Bergesons splurge didnt reflect a slavish devotion to basketball; he opened his wallet because he felt insecure about his languishing relationship with his friend, who he perceived to be getting closer to a new group of people.

title: Were Coming Back Stronger, Biden Says of Jobs Report
description: President Biden said the labor markets gain of 678,000 jobs in February demonstrated the nations progress against economic hits from the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Can I Still Wear Army Green?
description: Fashion has been enamored of military style for almost its entire existence, with designers regularly taking inspiration from all branches of the armed forces, be it color, shape, print, decoration.

title: New in Paperback: Klara and the Sun and The Committed
description: KLARA AND THE SUN, by Kazuo Ishiguro. (Vintage, 320 pp., $16.95.) Ishiguros eighth novel, about a humanoid machine that serves as a companion for a sickly teenager, is about love and humanity in a world where workers have been largely replaced by machines. With Klara and the Sun, our reviewer, Radhika Jones, commented, Ishiguro has mastered the adjacent theme of obsolescence.

title: The F.D.A. rejects an India-made Covid vaccine for those under 18.
description: The American pharmaceutical company Ocugen said on Friday that the Food and Drug Administration had rejected its application seeking emergency authorization for an India-made Covid vaccine for those ages 2 to 18.

title: Jewish New Yorkers Unite to Raise Millions for Ukraine
description: Rabbi Labish Becker, the executive director of Agudath Israel of America, an umbrella organization of ultra-Orthodox Jewish groups, has raised more than $2 million for Ukraine since the Russian invasion. He said the emergence of President Volodymyr Zelensky, who is Jewish, as a Ukrainian national hero, has been a source of pride for people amid the grim news of war.

title: Ukraines Call to Arms
description: From The Daily newsletter: One big idea on the news, from the team that brings you The Daily podcast. You can sign up for the newsletter here.

title: Adams Ends Pandemic Mandates in New York City Amid Concern He Is Rushing
description: Mayor Eric Adams opened a new chapter of the pandemic in New York City on Friday, ending requirements that masks be worn in public schools and that proof of vaccination be presented by those dining indoors, using gyms and going to entertainment venues.

title: The Battle for a Nuclear Plant
description: Good evening. This is your Russia-Ukraine War Briefing, a weeknight guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict.

title: In Kyivs Railway Station, Rumors, Near-Stampedes and Frustration
description: KYIV, Ukraine  The crowds of exhausted, frightened women and children at Kyivs central train station on Friday suddenly surged in a near-stampede to a station platform where a train heading to safety in western Ukraine was rumored to be arriving soon.

title: A suit filed by the A.C.L.U. accuses ICE jailers of denying detainees vaccines.
description: People with health conditions that place them at high risk from Covid-19 have been denied access to coronavirus vaccine booster shots while in federal immigration detention, the American Civil Liberties Union said in a lawsuit filed on Tuesday.

title: He Won an Olympic Silver for Ukraine. Now Hes Hiding in a Kyiv Garage.
description: Sixteen days earlier, Oleksandr Abramenko was in China, celebrating his silver medal  the only medal of any kind won by Ukraine at the Beijing Winter Games.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Great School Unmasking
description: As cases across the country plummet, more states are lifting mask mandates  and schools are following suit.

title: These Garlic Noodles Cross Cultures, but Are Deeply San Franciscan
description: Garlic noodles are not the San Francisco treat. That would be Rice-A-Roni, but garlic noodles are a San Francisco treat and one worth making for yourself.

title: Combat at Ukraine Nuclear Plant Adds Radioactive Dangers to Russian Invasion
description: LVIV, Ukraine  In darkness, Russia captured Europes largest nuclear power plant on Friday in Ukraine, prompting questions about the reasons it invaded the sprawling reactor site as well as the health risks to Ukrainians fighting desperately for their lives and freedom.

title: U.S. Cant Use Health Rule to Expel Migrant Families Facing Persecution, Court Says
description: WASHINGTON  A public health rule that has kept many undocumented migrants from entering the country during the pandemic suffered a blow on Friday, when a federal appeals court said it could no longer be used to expel families to countries where they would face persecution or torture.

title: A Hot Time in the Haunted House
description: A New York City apartment building with creepy neighbors and dark dealings in the basement, reminiscent of Rosemarys Baby. A rural town in which youre trapped with flesh-rending monsters, a little like The Mist. A rambling mansion that preys on the mind of its new resident, a struggling writer, like a suburban Connecticut version of The Shining.

title: Washington State Advances Landmark Deal on Gig Drivers Job Status
description: The Washington State Senate on Friday passed a bill granting gig drivers certain benefits and protections while preventing them from being classified as employees  a longstanding priority of ride-hailing companies like Uber and Lyft.

title: On the Scene: New York's Russian Enclave
description: We spoke with residents in one of the largest communities of Russian-speakers in this country about the invasion of Ukraine.

title: With Lucy and Desi, Amy Poehler Gets to the Heart of a Marriage
description: Near the beginning of the new Amy Poehler-directed documentary, Lucy and Desi, an audio recording plays. In it, Lucille Ball thanks her husband, Desi Arnaz, for her two beautiful, healthy children. Thats not exactly a shocking statement coming from a woman in 1950s America. Whats surprising is that Ball finishes by thanking her husband for her freedom. Its one of many moments in the film that might cause those who think they know the story of these stars, and this couple, to lean in a little closer.

title: Pistols, Assault Rifles, Zip Ties: Witness Describes Preparation for Jan. 6
description: WASHINGTON  Just before they went to hear President Donald J. Trump speak on the day of the Capitol riot last year, Rocky Hardie, at the time a member of a Texas militia, and a friend, Guy Wesley Reffitt, made their preparations, Mr. Hardie testified in federal court on Friday.

title: Republicans Sharpen Their Message on Ukraine
description: Immediately after Russias invasion of Ukraine, the political debate in the U.S. was a free-for-all. Democrats and some Republicans aligned behind President Biden exhibiting what was once considered a traditional show of unity in a crisis. Other Republicans blasted Biden as weak and insufficiently tough on Russia. In perhaps the strangest twist, still other Republicans, including Donald Trump, seemed to sympathize with Russias president, Vladimir Putin.

title: Lionel James, Speedy Back Who Covered a Lot of Turf, Dies at 59
description: Lionel James, a fast, elusive running back nicknamed Little Train, who shared the backfield with Bo Jackson at Auburn University and set a single-season N.F.L. record for all-purpose yards that stood for 15 years, died on Feb. 25 in Birmingham, Ala. He was 59.

title: Several Western news organizations suspend operations in Russia.
description: Several Western media organizations moved on Friday to suspend their journalistic operations in Russia in the wake of a harsh new crackdown on news and free speech by President Vladimir V. Putins government.

title: Russians Seize Europes Biggest Nuclear Plant and Gain in the South as More Ukrainians Flee
description: KYIV, Ukraine  Russian forces in Ukraine seized Europes biggest nuclear power plant on Friday, tightened their noose around the capital and threatened more southern cities in their march to control the Black Sea coast, intensifying the deadly destruction and chaos from the eight-day-old invasion.

title: Zelensky criticizes NATO over its rejection of a no-fly zone.
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine criticized NATO late Friday night over its rejection of a no-fly zone, hours after the alliance announced it would not intervene by air or land for fear of creating a conflict with Russia that could spill into other parts of Europe.

title: Corrections: March 5, 2022
description: An article on Page 1 this weekend about the Brooklyn enclave Red Hook misspells the surname of the real estate mogul for whom a pool in Red Hook was named. He was Sol Goldman, not Goodman.

title: North Korea Launches Ballistic Missile, South Korea Says
description: SEOUL  North Korea on Saturday launched a ballistic missile toward the sea off its east coast, its second missile test in a week, South Korean defense officials said.

title: Florida Senate Passes Voting Bill to Create Election Crimes Agency
description: The Florida Senate passed a sweeping new bill overhauling the states electoral process, adding new restrictions to the state election code and establishing a law enforcement office dedicated solely to investigating election crimes.

title: China Outlines Plan to Stabilize Economy in Crucial Year for Xi
description: BEIJING  Plowing past global anxieties over the war engulfing Ukraine, China set its economy on a course of steady expansion for 2022, prioritizing growth, job creation and increased social welfare in a year when the national leader, Xi Jinping, is poised to claim a new term in power.

title: Tim Considine, Young Star of My Three Sons, Is Dead at 81
description: Tim Considine, who was a television star at the age of 14 in Disneys Spin and Marty and went on to wider fame in the family series My Three Sons, died on Thursday at his home in the Mar Vista section of Los Angeles. He was 81.

title: Ex-Amtrak Engineer Acquitted in Philadelphia Crash That Killed 8
description: A former Amtrak engineer who was operating a speeding train that derailed in Philadelphia in 2015, killing eight people, was acquitted on Friday of involuntary manslaughter and related charges.

title: Finland, Non-NATO and Nervous, Discusses Defense With Biden
description: WASHINGTON  When President Biden met in the Oval Office on Friday afternoon with Sauli Niinisto, the president of the non-NATO member and increasingly nervous Finland, Mr. Biden tried to put his guest at ease with a little banter recalling something that Barack Obama once said.

title: Quotation of the Day: In Tennessee, Maus Fight Is Part of Bigger Battle
description: Not being able to speak to the things that I think are really important  not being able to express myself  is a little bit frustrating at times when it seems like everyone else is having no trouble expressing themselves louder and louder.

title: The time has come: Gov. Murphy of New Jersey ends his daily virus briefings.
description: Gov. Philip D. Murphy of New Jersey held his final daily coronavirus briefing on Friday, announcing that he would lift the states public health emergency in the coming week, a significant moment for a state that was an early epicenter of the virus.

title: Unlikely to Tip
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  This is a very elegant grid, Nam Jin Yoons sixth Saturday construction in a row for The Times. If you find your eyes drawn to the arrowhead-like set of squares in the northwest corner, thats because the puzzle has diagonal symmetry, using the northwest-southeast diagonal as its axis. This arrangement had a strange effect on my solve, as I mentally swept the four long answers at 12-Across, 12-Down, 14-Across and 14-Down to the side and filled them all in at the very end, using a lot of crosses. I consider all four of those entries really good stumpers.

title: Middle Grade Fiction That Sees the Forest for the Trees
description: SOLIMARThe Sword of the MonarchsBy Pam Muoz Ryan

title: What Is Bigorexia?
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Spelling Bee Forum

title: A Paranoid Persons Guide to Preparing for Digital Danger
description: What if the lights go out? Or A.T.M. networks go down? Or digital giants like Google that I trust with vital information come under attack?

title: Crescendos of Crickets and Choruses of Frogs
description: SOUNDS WILD AND BROKEN: Sonic Marvels, Evolutions Creativity, and the Crisis of Sensory Extinction, by David George Haskell

title: William P. Barrs Good Donald Trump and Bad Donald Trump
description: ONE DAMN THING AFTER ANOTHERMemoirs of an Attorney GeneralBy William P. Barr

title: Actress Morena Baccarin Cooks a Brazilian Stew
description: If I take these home to my kids and they dont like them, Im going to kill them, the actress Morena Baccarin said.

title: The 2 Political Operatives at the Center of a New Jersey Murder Mystery
description: In 2015, six years before Sean Caddle, a New Jersey campaign consultant, wound up at the center of the states most talked-about murder mystery, he began what seemed to be an unusual business venture. He called it Chainsaw Productions.

title: When Did You Last Clean Bug Splatter Off Your Windshield?
description: THE INSECT CRISIS: The Fall of the Tiny Empires That Run the World, by Oliver Milman

title: You Quit Your Job, but You Still Need a Retirement Plan
description: When she realized she wanted to quit her job at a San Francisco software company, Anna Rider was taking care of two babies: a food blog that she wanted to grow, and her actual child  the son she had five months ago.

title: Too Close to Putin? Institutions Vet Artists, Uncomfortably.
description: In Canada, an acclaimed 20-year-old Russian pianists concert was canceled amid concerns about his silence on the invasion of Ukraine. The music director of an orchestra in Toulouse, France  who is also the chief conductor at the Bolshoi Theater in Moscow  was instructed to clarify his position on the war before his next appearance. In New York, Anna Netrebko, one of operas biggest stars, saw her reign at the Metropolitan Opera end after she declined to denounce President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

title: How Moms to Be Get to Act More Like Dads
description: For the past nine months, I have been pregnant. But I have not  for the most part  been pregnant at work.

title: I Just Cant Stand By: American Veterans Join the Fight in Ukraine
description: Hector served two violent tours in Iraq as a United States Marine, then got out, got a pension and a civilian job, and thought he was done with military service. But on Friday, he boarded a plane for one more deployment, this time as a volunteer in Ukraine. He checked in several bags filled with rifle scopes, helmets and body armor donated by other veterans.

title: Hollywood Bets Big on the Bad Entrepreneur
description: Im not a bad guy, the Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg (Jesse Eisenberg) insists at the end of The Social Network, the 2010 film that defined the cultural response to young tech billionaires. Zuckerbergs thoughtful lawyer (Rashida Jones), an invented character who serves largely to adjudicate Zuckerbergs personality, assures him that she doesnt think hes a jerk: Youre just trying so hard to be one.

title: The Best Time to Use Your Airline Miles? Now.
description: Frances Meredith of Raleigh, N.C. used a branded American Airlines credit card for everything from groceries to medical expenses during the pandemic, piling up points with nowhere to spend them. That meant she had plenty to redeem when her family of four decided it was time for a winter getaway to Miami. Although the seats were pricey at 50,000 points each, Dr. Meredith, an internist, was excited to save money by using her rewards balance. It was easy. There were lots of seats, she said.

title: TikTok Is Gripped by the Violence and Misinformation of Ukraine War
description: Bre Hernandez used to scan TikTok for videos of makeup tutorials and taco truck reviews. Since Russia invaded Ukraine, the 19-year-old has spent hours each day scrolling the app for war videos, watching graphic footage of Ukrainian tanks firing on Russian troops and civilians running away from enemy gunfire.

title: Zelensky and Trump: Two Performers, One Hero
description: WASHINGTON  History is full of strange odysseys and intersections.

title: Advertising Acts as Another Vehicle of Protest to Ukraine War
description: As western social media sites tried to block misleading ads coming out of Russia this week, Rob Blackie was trying to sneak ads in.

title: In Ukraines West, Lviv Makes Itself a Vital Rear Base
description: LVIV, Ukraine  Municipal workers were wrapping statues in protective coverings and boarding up the stained-glass windows of the many churches that fill this historic European city in western Ukraine, as the population readied for war.

title: Wildlife Personalities Play a Role in Nature
description: In August, a mountain lion was sighted several times prowling the suburbs of New Canaan, Conn., and not for the first time. A decade ago, a young mountain lion made its way to Connecticut, prowling more than 1,500 miles from the Black Hills of South Dakota, before it was killed crossing a highway.

title: Build a New City or New Humans? A Utopia in India Fights Over Future.
description: AUROVILLE, India  The bulldozer arrived one night in December, shaking Ganga Park awake in her tree house and sending her scurrying down the trunk.

title: How the West Marshaled a Stunning Show of Unity Against Russia
description: LONDON  The day after Russian tanks and troops poured across the Ukrainian border on Feb. 24, NATO leaders received a deeply frightening message. The alliances secretary general, Jens Stoltenberg, opened an emergency video summit by warning that President Vladimir V. Putin had shattered peace in Europe and that from now on, he would openly contest the continents security order.

title: While Canada Welcomes Refugees, Its Door Is Far From Wide Open
description: By Friday afternoon, one million people had fled Ukraine, mostly to neighboring countries, according to estimates from the U.N. refugee agency, U.N.H.C.R. As with other recent wars, resettlement groups in Canada are preparing to receive many of those who are expected to land here.

title: True Stories
description: Atlanta returns for its third season on March 24, and Ive got it marked on my calendar, not just because its been nearly four years since the last season, but because it stands out as an original series in the flood of docudramatic reimaginations of real-life events that has overtaken streaming platforms of late.

title: Here are the latest developments in the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
description: LVIV, Ukraine  As his troops continued to run into stiff resistance in Ukraine, President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia delivered an ominous message to Ukrainians on Saturday, telling government leaders they might lose their statehood and likening the withering sanctions imposed on his country to a declaration of war.

title: Why American Mask Makers Are Going Out of Business
description: The DealBook newsletter delves into a single topic or theme every weekend, providing reporting and analysis that offers a better understanding of an important issue in business. If you dont already receive the daily newsletter, sign up here.

title: Aeroflot says it will suspend international flights.
description: Russias state airline, Aeroflot, said on Saturday that it would suspend all international flights from Tuesday due to additional circumstances that prevent the performance of flights.

title: California Woman Is Charged With Faking Her Own Abduction in 2016
description: She said that her captors had leashed her to a pole inside a closet, a bucket of kitty litter serving as her toilet. Then came the beatings. And when she tried to escape, she told investigators, she was branded.

title: Were Entering a Period of Relatively Low Covid Risk for Kids
description: Earlier this week, I saw this Times headline skitter across my Twitter feed: Pfizer Shot Is Far Less Effective in 5- to 11-Year-Olds Than in Older Kids, New Data Show. An online preprint of a study of 852,384 fully vaccinated children 12 to 17 years old and 365,502 children 5 to 11 years old in New York State found that although kids in that 5 to 11 range were protected against severe disease, they werent well protected against infection from the Omicron variant.

title: Brittney Griner, Star W.N.B.A. Center, Is Detained in Russia
description: WASHINGTON  Russia said on Saturday that it had detained an American basketball player  quickly identified as Phoenix Mercury center Brittney Griner  on drug charges, entangling a U.S. citizens fate in the dangerous confrontation between Russia and the West over Ukraine.

title: A Welcome Steeped in History: Ukrainian Refugees Arrive in Germany
description: BERLIN  After an anxious eight-day journey fleeing a war that has since swallowed his hometown in eastern Ukraine, the welcome as he stepped off a train at Berlin Central Station felt faintly surreal to 15-year-old Dima Chornii.

title: How to Negotiate Your Rent (Which Is Probably Going Up)
description: Q: The lease on my daughters Midtown Manhattan apartment expires in May, and she is concerned about a rent hike. When she signed the lease, she got two months of free rent. Now, comparable units in the building are renting for 35 percent more than what shes paying. Could the landlord really raise her rent that much? Can she negotiate?

title: U.S. and Allies Discuss Security of Ukraines Leaders Amid Fears for Zelenskys Safety
description: WASHINGTON  Allied governments have been discussing how to secure the line of succession in Ukraine in the event President Volodymyr Zelensky is captured or killed by Russian forces, according to officials from multiple governments.

title: Ukrainian protesters take to the streets in occupied Kherson.
description: ODESSA, Ukraine  Kherson, in southern Ukraine, was the first major city to fall to Russian forces and now popular street protests are presenting a challenge to the new authority there.

title: On Ukraine, I Know What I Dont Know
description: You may have noticed, as readers of this newsletter (and presumably of my column as well), that I have not said or written much about the war in Ukraine.

title: Putins Fear of Free Speech Speaks Volumes
description: On Friday, the Russian government blocked access to Twitter, Facebook and multiple news sites, in an effort to stop people from speaking out against the war in Ukraine. The state also shut down the pillars of the countrys independent media, including the radio station Echo of Moscow that was launched by Soviet dissidents in 1990. And on Friday, the Duma passed a law punishing anyone who spreads false information about the Russian military, which could include anyone calling what is taking place in Ukraine a war, with a possible 15 years in prison.

title: Putin Picked the Wrong Country to Mess With
description: PRZEMYSL, Poland  For months, Ukraine worried and agonized about a potential invasion. But in just over one week of hellish war, Ukrainians revealed themselves to be some of the bravest people in the world. Against Russias full-scale assault, civilians across the country have been courageously, even terrifyingly, defiant.

title: Pakistan Identifies Peshawar Suicide Bomber and Network, Police Say
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Pakistani police investigators said on Saturday that they had identified the suicide bomber and the network behind the deadly blast on Friday at a Shiite mosque in Peshawar, in northwestern Pakistan, that left at least 63 dead and nearly 200 wounded.

title: How the Manhattan D.A.s Investigation Into Donald Trump Unraveled
description: On a late January afternoon, two senior prosecutors stood before the new Manhattan district attorney, hoping to persuade him to criminally charge the former president of the United States.

title: Prenatal Tests, Disabilities and the Decision Whether to Abort
description: To the Editor:

title: Russian Forces Pound Civilians, as Putin Likens Sanctions to a Declaration of War
description: ODESSA, Ukraine  President Vladimir V. Putin warned on Saturday that crippling economic sanctions imposed by the West were akin to a declaration of war, as the Russian military pummeled civilian targets and continued shelling near the first protected routes intended to allow besieged Ukrainians to flee, apparently violating a cease-fire that had been agreed to only hours earlier.

title: Meeting with Congress, Zelensky asks for more jets and a no-fly zone.
description: WASHINGTON  President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine spoke with more than 300 members of Congress on Saturday, imploring them to ban the importation of Russian oil and to send more jets to his country, according to lawmakers on the call.

title: Maggy Hurchalla, Formidable Florida Environmentalist, Dies at 81
description: The classic Maggy Hurchalla introduction would go something like this: Come to my house, shed say. Well go kayaking.

title: Blinken Pledges Additional Humanitarian Aid to Ukraine
description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said that the Biden administration has asked Congress to approve $2.75 billion in humanitarian assistance for vulnerable communities inside Ukraine and refugee services in neighboring countries.

title: Alice von Hildebrand, Conservative Catholic Philosopher, Dies at 98
description: The Roman Catholic philosopher Alice von Hildebrand lived to be 98, but her life almost ended one night in June 1940, when she was just 17.

title: Tony Walton, Award-Winning Stage and Screen Designer, Dies at 87
description: Tony Walton, a production designer who brought a broad visual imagination to the creation of distinct onstage looks for Broadway shows over a half-century, earning him three Tony Awards, died on Wednesday at his home in Manhattan. He was 87.

title: Israeli prime minister visits Moscow for talks with Putin on Ukraine.
description: Prime Minister Naftali Bennett of Israel traveled to Moscow to meet at the Kremlin with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, according to Israeli and Russian officials, a rare moment of diplomacy in a war that has stretched into its second week.

title: How to Stop a Nuclear War
description: In September 1983, Stanislav Petrov was a lieutenant colonel in the Soviet military, assigned to the command center that monitored early-warning satellites over the United States. During one of his shifts, the alarms went off: The Americans had seemingly launched five Minuteman intercontinental ballistic missiles.

title: Boises mayor, who championed Covid restrictions, says she faces violent threats and harassment.
description: Lauren McLean, the mayor of Boise, Idaho, said that she has faced real and grave threats during her term, which has been marked by aggressive demonstrations against Covid-19 restrictions that she and other state officials put in place.

title: The State of Fighting in Ukraines Besieged Cities
description: Blackened and bombed-out apartment towers. Families huddled together in subway stations. Downtown streets made silent, with shuttered cafes and nightclubs.

title: U.S. intelligence weighs Putins two years of extreme pandemic isolation as a factor in his wartime mind-set.
description: The White House effort to design a strategy to confront Russia over its invasion of Ukraine is linked to an urgent re-examination by intelligence agencies of President Vladimir V. Putins mental state. The debate is over whether his ambitions and appetite for risk have been altered by two years of Covid isolation, or by a sense that this may be his best moment to rebuild Russias sphere of influence and secure his legacy. Or both.

title: On the Scene: Ukrainians protest in Kherson
description: Kherson, in southern Ukraine, was the first major city to fall to Russian forces. On Saturday, street protests presented a challenge to the new authority there. Heres what happened that morning

title: Mitchell Ryan, Who Played the Villain in Lethal Weapon, Dies at 88
description: Mitchell Ryan, an actor known for his role in the gothic soap opera Dark Shadows and who played a heroin-dealing retired general in the action movie Lethal Weapon, died on Friday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 88.

title: Fast-food chains and food producers stay open in Russia, and mostly quiet about Ukraine.
description: While technology giants like Apple and luxury retailers like  Herms have quickly moved to pause sales or shutter stores in Russia over the invasion of Ukraine, most U.S. food companies and fast-food chains have remained open  and largely silent.

title: Blinken Arrives in Poland to Gauge Additional U.S. Aid for Ukraine
description: KORCZOWA, Poland  With a line of refugees streaming into Poland behind them, the top American and Ukrainian diplomats met at Ukraines border on Saturday in a brief but extraordinary encounter to assess what additional support and protection the United States might deliver to address Russias invasion, which appeared certain to continue.

title: U.S. Officials Travel to Venezuela, a Russia Ally, as the West Isolates Putin
description: Senior U.S. officials are traveling to Venezuela on Saturday to meet with the government of President Nicols Maduro, according to people familiar with the matter, as the Biden administration steps up efforts to separate Russia from its remaining international allies amid a widening standoff over Ukraine.

title: Wildfires in Florida Panhandle Prompt Evacuations
description: Three fast-moving wildfires in the Florida Panhandle have consumed more than 10,000 acres and forced the evacuation of more than 1,100 homes, the authorities said.

title: Parlor Trick
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Today we have a visually unusual challenge by two excellent constructors, Matthew Stock and Will Nediger, who are collaborating for the first time in The New York Times. According to the puzzles print introduction, the two connected online and developed a theme conceived by Mr. Stock, using direct messages on Twitter and swapping grids until they were both happy. They have yet to meet, even on video.

title: Mastercard and Visa suspend operations in Russia.
description: Mastercard and Visa said they would suspend operations in Russia, essentially severing cardholders there from transactions outside the country in response to the invasion of Ukraine.

title: Russian Prisoners and Ukrainian Soldiers Describe Two Sides of the Conflict
description: KYIV, Ukraine  With hands still dirty from the battlefield, a dozen Russian prisoners of war sat, stony-faced, in a conference room of a Ukrainian news agency on Saturday and described being captured after their armored columns were ambushed.

title: Truckers protesting Covid mandates are amassing outside the capital.
description: One group of truckers called the Peoples Convoy that left California more than a week ago made it to the East Coast and was stationed on Saturday in Hagerstown, Md., about 70 miles northwest of the capital, converging with other drivers and their supporters  opening up the possibility that the convoy could move into Washington to hold protests against pandemic restrictions in the next few days.

title: Why Brittney Griner and Other W.N.B.A. Stars Play Overseas
description: Brittney Griner, a center for the Phoenix Mercury, has been detained in Russia in connection with a drug investigation. She had been there playing for the professional basketball team UMMC Ekaterinburg during the W.N.B.A. off-season. The news of her detention on Saturday prompted questions about safety and politics but also about logistics  namely: Why was one of the W.N.B.A.s best players competing in Russia anyway?

title: Tornadoes Rampage Across Iowa, Killing 7, Officials Say
description: Seven people, including two children, were killed in Iowa on Saturday as communities across the state were battered by at least three tornadoes that destroyed dozens of homes, the authorities said.

title: Mexico Soccer Riot Leaves 26 Injured, Officials Say
description: MEXICO CITY  A soccer game in central Mexico descended into violent clashes between fans of the opposing teams on Saturday. The authorities said 26 people had been injured, three of them critically.

title: Boris Johnson: 6 Steps the West Must Take to Help Ukraine Right Now
description: LONDON  Over the past week, in response to the gut-wrenching scenes in Ukraine, Western unity has been impressive and heartening. I know from my near-daily conversations with President Volodymyr Zelensky that this has provided Ukrainians with some comfort in their hour of need.

title: The Cancellation of Mother Russia Is Underway
description: With every passing day, the war in Ukraine becomes a bigger tragedy for the Ukrainian people but also a bigger threat to the future of Europe and the world at large. There is only one country that might have the power to stop it now, and its not the United States. Its China.

title: Corrections: March 6, 2022
description: An article on Feb. 20 about Sam Waterston and Law & Order misstated the location of the school where Waterstons father taught. It was in northeast Massachusetts, not northwest Massachusetts.

title: Quotation of the Day: After Zelenskys Plea, the West Raced to Form a United Front
description: They do not keep up with new threats. They are not effective for overcoming them. This is a cough syrup when you need a coronavirus vaccine.

title: On S.N.L., Tucker Carlson and Laura Ingraham Make Amends
description: A comedy sketch that ended with former President Trump performing a fairly sincere rendition of My Funny Valentine was not nearly the most baroque moment of this weekends Saturday Night Live, which was hosted by Oscar Isaac. (That particular honor would go to a routine about singing meatballs, which well get to shortly.)

title: A Thunderous Farewell at Duke for Coach K, Even in Defeat
description: DURHAM, N.C.  Before we get to the score, you should  no, you must  know what it was like at Cameron Indoor Stadium on Saturday evening. That is the only way to appreciate what happened.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: SUNDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: I Tried to Pick Up My Pace, Hunching Forward Into the Wind
description: Dear Diary:

title: High Demand for Drug to Prevent Covid in the Vulnerable, Yet Doses Go Unused
description: Sasha Mallett, Sue Taylor and Kimberly Cooley all have immune deficiencies that make them especially vulnerable to Covid-19, and all have tried to get the same thing: a new treatment that can prevent the disease in people who either cannot produce antibodies after receiving a coronavirus vaccine or cannot get vaccinated at all.

title: Most Women Denied Abortions by Texas Law Got Them Another Way
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Here is the latest news about Russias invasion of Ukraine.
description: LVIV, Ukraine  After Western nations rejected his appeal to impose a no-fly zone over the country, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine on Sunday called on the entire nation to resist the Russian invasion. He cheered the courage of protesters who filled the streets of occupied cities and towns, saying that every meter of our Ukrainian land won by protest and humiliation of the invaders is a step forward, a step toward victory.

title: The Gangs of Fashion
description: PARIS  It was 9:30 p.m. on a Friday and the crowd in the Fourth Arrondissement was a pulsating mass of bodies, crushed together and shoving forward, on the edge of out of control. Security guards were yelling and trying to shut a pair of ornate iron gates to limit entry, and guests desperate to get in were yelling right back.

title: Heres why Western leaders are reluctant to impose a no-fly zone over Ukraine.
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky and others have called for NATO to impose a no-fly zone over Ukraine to counter the threat from Russian military aircraft. For now, NATO leaders have said they arent willing, fearful such a move could drag them into a broader war with Russia.

title: Indicted. Under F.B.I. Investigation. And Still Popular With Texas Republicans.
description: SAN ANTONIO  The race for Texas attorney general is asking Republicans to determine how many indictments and allegations of corruption are too many. The answer may be there is no limit  so long as the candidate has an endorsement from former President Donald J. Trump.

title: Pets Have Put On Pandemic Weight, Too
description: Humans weren't the only ones who gained weight during lockdown.

title: A Poem (and a Painting) About the Suffering That Hides in Plain Sight
description: With war looming, W.H. Auden stood in a museum and was inspired to write. The resulting poem, Muse des Beaux Arts, is one of the most famous ever written about art.

title: NoViolet Bulawayo Allegorizes the Aftermath of Robert Mugabe
description: GLORY By NoViolet Bulawayo

title: Q. & A.: How to Deal With Running Injuries
description: The worlds greatest runners speak poetically about how they deal with physical pain.

title: Fraud Is Flourishing on Zelle. The Banks Say Its Not Their Problem.
description: Justin Faunce lost $500 to a scammer impersonating a Wells Fargo official in January and hoped that the bank would reimburse him. Mr. Faunce was a longtime Wells Fargo customer and had immediately reported the scam  involving Zelle, the popular money transfer app.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1 Million
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: My Wife Tracked Me, for Journalism
description: Kashmir Hill recently published an article in The Times in which she detailed how she digitally followed her husbands movements for a month using GPS and other location trackers.

title: Asian Americans Grapple With Tide of Attacks: We Need Our Safety Back
description: She was attacked as she swept up in front of her Queens home in November, beaten in the head with a rock so viciously that she was in a coma for weeks.

title: Fossil Reveals Secrets of One of Natures Most Mysterious Reptiles
description: New Zealands tuatara look like somber iguanas. But these spiny reptiles are not actually lizards. Instead, they are the last remnant of a mysterious and ancient order of reptiles known as the Rhynchocephalians that mostly vanished after their heyday in the Jurassic period.

title: How to View the Northern Lights From New England and the Midwest
description: Several years ago, on a cold, mid-March evening at about 10 p.m., I took my dogs out for a walk beyond the lights of our home in Carbondale, Colo. The sky was ablaze with stars, and as I looked up for the Big Dipper and the North Star, I noticed that the far horizon pulsated in a green glow. I couldnt believe that I was seeing the northern lights.
