title: Fossil of Vampire Squids Oldest Ancestor Is Named for Biden
description: About 328 million years ago, Fergus County, Mont., was no stranger to monsoons. Back then, the region was a marine bay, much like the Bay of Bengal in South Asia. The tropical storms regularly flushed the bay with freshwater and fine sediments, feeding algal blooms and depleting the water of oxygen in certain spots. Anything that died in these spots could have the rare posthumous luck of being preserved, undisturbed.

title: U.N. Human Rights Chief to Visit China
description: GENEVA  The United Nations top human rights official said on Tuesday that China would allow her to visit the country and examine conditions there, including in the Xinjiang region, a startling twist after years of negotiations and stonewalling by Beijing.

title: How to Master the Pull-Up
description: Ive always loved pull-ups, partly out of spite. There is a common fitness refrain that women cant do them, and I dont like to be told I cant do something  especially if the reason is my gender. As a teenager, I pushed lawn-mowers and hauled rocks just to show that being a girl didnt mean I was weak.

title: Here are the latest developments in the war in Ukraine.
description: LVIV, Ukraine  As Russia continued to bombard cities across Ukraine, attacks that have killed hundreds of civilians and displaced millions, the war was exacting an increasing toll beyond the battlefield.

title: F.B.I. Sees Massive Fraud in Groups Food Programs for Needy Children
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Last year, with the federal government making available huge new sums of money for programs to feed needy children during the pandemic, a nonprofit organization called Advance Youth Athletic Development set up what it described as an enormous child care operation in northeast Minneapolis that could prepare 5,000 dinners each weeknight.

title: A New Direction in NoLIta
description: Once known for New Zealand cuisine, Musket Room is now open to influences from around the globe.

title: Goodbye New Zealand, Hello World
description: The news that Matt Lambert, the chef who made Musket Room a lonely outpost of New Zealand cuisine in NoLIta, had been replaced by Mary Attea in February 2020 did not exactly echo throughout the land. At least, I didnt hear about it. Then the engine fell out of the restaurant economy a few weeks later, and details like changes of kitchen leadership seemed even less urgent.

title: Former Proud Boys Leader Indicted in Jan. 6 Investigation
description: Enrique Tarrio, the former leader of the Proud Boys, was charged in a federal indictment unsealed on Tuesday with conspiring with other top lieutenants of the far-right nationalist group to disrupt the certification of the 2020 presidential election by helping to plan and launch the attack on the Capitol last year.

title: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Fiona Hill
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode with Fiona Hill. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: Biden bans U.S. imports of Russian oil and natural gas, and Britain vows to phase Russian oil out.
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden said Tuesday that the United States was punishing Russia for a vicious war of choice in Ukraine by banning importation of the countrys oil, gas and coal, but warned Americans that the decision would inevitably mean painful, higher prices for energy and at the gas pump.

title: Suddenly, oil companies are upbeat again
description: If youve been following climate news, you might feel a bit of vertigo at what Im about to tell you.

title: Apple Has to Try Hard Now
description: If Apple were a person, it wouldnt be the type who runs to catch a flight and skids up to the gate in a flop sweat. Apple would saunter, calm and unhurried. Trying hard is not cool.

title: How the Putin Shock Might Affect the World Economy
description: When Vladimir Putin invaded Ukraine, I think its fair to say that most observers expected him to get away with it. Surely Russias huge military would take Kyiv and other major cities within a few days; surely the West would respond with its usual timidity, giving Russia no more than a minor slap on the wrist.

title: Beyond Beyonc Fame, Awol Erizku Expands What Black Art Can Be
description: LOS ANGELES  True, Awol Erizku may be best known for his beatific photograph of a pregnant Beyonc, which in 2017 was the most liked post in Instagrams history. And Erizku has taken many other memorable images of celebrities, including the young inauguration poet Amanda Gorman for the cover of Time and the Black Panther actor Michael B. Jordan for GQ.

title: U.S. gas prices hit a high: $4.17 a gallon.
description: Gas prices, which have been steadily rising for weeks as the conflict in Ukraine has escalated, hit a new high in the United States on Tuesday.

title: Kony 2012, 10 Years Later
description: At the start of 2012, much of the world had never heard of Joseph Kony, a Central African warlord responsible, by UNICEFs count, for abducting tens of thousands of children to enslave them and use them as soldiers, and for displacing more than 2.5 million people throughout the region.

title: Praise for Bidens Courage in Imposing Oil Sanctions Against Russia
description: To the Editor:

title: Mels, Wood-Fired Pizza From a Former Del Posto Chef, Opens
description: Fitted snugly to one side of the former Del Posto, the narrow restaurant space that was once John Dory is now a pizzeria: Mels, the first restaurant of a new food complex here. The name refers to the former Del Posto and Daniel chef Melissa J. Rodriguez, who is partnering with Jeff Katz and James Kent of Crown Shy and Saga to develop this sprawling space. (Al Coro, a lavish Italian restaurant, and Discolo, a lower-level lounge, will open in the Del Posto space in early summer.) Mels is done warmly in orange tones and polished light wood, a bar and a dining counter open into a rear dining room, and a huge wood-fired pizza oven is central to the space. Everything is cooked with wood, Ms. Rodriguez said. Theres no gas here. The pizzas start with Margherita but quickly veer into creative territory: mushrooms, smoked mozzarella and shaved shallots; and kale, basil pesto, ricotta and preserved lemon. Many appetizers, like roasted parsnips with robiola cheese, roasted maitake mushrooms with soppressata piccante, and charred shrimp, are wood fired, as are mains like whole fish, whole roasted cauliflower and strip steak. Unlike at most pizzerias, dessert is neither an afterthought nor skippable. Consider milk chocolate gelato with dark chocolate sable swirl; salted caramel and fior di latte gelato with caramel sauce and shortbread crumble; or an Italian rainbow cookie hot fudge sundae, a tribute to Little Italy. The timing of the opening is calculated so that Ms. Rodriguez, a Culinary Institute of America graduate, has several months to get Mels in order before Al Coro is unveiled. (Opens Wednesday)

title: The Long Shadow of Sandy Hook
description: So were living in a world where, according to several polls, the majority of Republican voters believe Joe Biden stole the 2020 election, and some 41 million Americans are said to believe in QAnon. The rest of us, meanwhile, are struggling to explain when, precisely, our politics became so detached from reality. Some look to the propagandistic Clinton-hating conspiracies of the 1990s as the moment things started to change. Others blame the 9/11 truthers, or the original autism-related anti-vaccine panic. In her persuasive and heartbreaking new book, Elizabeth Williamson points to the horrific mass shooting in Newtown, Conn., on Dec. 14, 2012, when 20 children and six adults at Sandy Hook Elementary School were killed, and then a host of internet trolls set out to convince the world it didnt happen.

title: Cabaret, Starring Eddie Redmayne, Leads Olivier Award Nominees
description: LONDON  A revival of Cabaret that has been a topic of conversation here for its sky-high ticket prices as much as its stellar cast dominated the nominations for this years Olivier Awards  Britains equivalent of the Tonys  that were announced on Tuesday.

title: McDonalds, Coca-Cola and Starbucks temporarily stop sales in Russia.
description: After days of silence and seeming reluctance to take a stance while facing rising pressure to respond to Russias invasion of Ukraine, several iconic American food and beverage companies said on Tuesday that they were pausing operations in Russia.

title: Texas Man Convicted in First Jan. 6 Trial
description: A federal jury on Tuesday swiftly convicted the first accused Jan. 6 rioter to go on trial even as prosecutors announced they had expanded their inquiry by indicting a former leader of the Proud Boys, the far-right nationalist group that played a prominent role in the Capitol attack.

title: The Loophole Thats Fueling a Return to Teenage Vaping
description: The Food and Drug Administrations crackdown on flavored e-cigarettes in 2020 was meant to be a comprehensive, aggressive strategy to curtail the epidemic of teenage vaping.

title: Prince Andrew Has Paid Settlement to Virginia Giuffre, Her Lawyer Says
description: A lawsuit accusing Prince Andrew, the disgraced second son of Queen Elizabeth II and a former friend of the notorious sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, of raping Virginia Giuffre when she was a teenager was dismissed by a federal judge on Tuesday, following a request from both parties.

title: Apple unveils a new iPhone, a new iPad and other devices.
description: Apples latest product showcase on Tuesday had all the hallmarks of a typical launch for the worlds most valuable public company: vibrant colors, upbeat music, a slate of incremental product improvements and a surprise.

title: Moldovans Welcome Fleeing Ukrainians, but Some Pack Their Own Bags, Too
description: PURCARI, Moldova  Angela Dragan, a chef at a famous Moldovan winery, has spent the past two weeks making food for the exodus of refugees fleeing the invasion in neighboring Ukraine, and has hosted at least 10 of them in her home. There but for the grace of God, she reckons.

title: Aaron Rodgers Says He Has a Deal to Stay With the Packers
description: Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers, a four-time N.F.L. most valuable player, has agreed to remain with the team, concluding his yearlong back-and-forth with the club about his future.

title: Smithsonian to Return Most of Its Benin Bronze Collection to Nigeria
description: The Smithsonian Institution, one of the worlds largest cultural organizations, said on Tuesday that it planned to return most of its collection of Benin Bronzes to Nigeria, a sweeping move that would punctuate a monthslong institutional review of its collection practices and the ethics behind them.

title: Amazon Web Services blocks new sign-ups from Russia and Belarus.
description: Amazon has quietly stopped letting customers in Russia and Belarus open new cloud computing accounts.

title: Grand Jury Appears Set to Weigh Charges Against Deshaun Watson
description: Nearly a year after allegations of sexual misconduct against Deshaun Watson were first publicized, several women who filed criminal complaints against him have been subpoenaed to appear before a grand jury on Friday, according to their lawyer, Tony Buzbee.

title: What Young New Yorkers Think About the End of the School Mask Mandate
description: New York City officials this week eliminated the mask mandate for public school students that had been in place since fall 2020, an aggressive step toward normalcy two years after the coronavirus began battering the city.

title: Chinese companies that aid Russia could face U.S. repercussions, commerce secretary warns.
description: Gina Raimondo, the secretary of commerce, issued a stern warning Tuesday to Chinese companies that might defy U.S. restrictions against exporting to Russia, saying the United States would cut them off from American equipment and software they need to make their products.

title: Booth Pushes an Assassin Off Center Stage
description: Why did you do it, Johnny? Nobody agrees.

title: Sixteen Years After The Road, Cormac McCarthy Is Publishing Two New Novels
description: During a rare appearance in Santa Fe, N.M., in 2015, Cormac McCarthy offered a tantalizing glimpse of his work in progress: The Passenger, a novel that explored esoteric ideas about math, physics and the nature of consciousness.

title: Ukrainian Dancers Find Shelter Abroad as War Rages at Home
description: PARIS  When Ivan Kozlov landed in France with the Kyiv City Ballet on Feb. 23, the drumbeat of a possible Russian attack on Ukraine was growing louder. But he still didnt think that President Vladimir V. Putins forces would invade.

title: The War in Ukraine Puts Americas Problems in Perspective
description: Heartbroken over what the Russian regime is currently doing to the nation of Ukraine, I cant help finding myself thinking also of ways were taught to think about ourselves as a nation. Perhaps strangely, while I find myself sifting through the grim news of recent days, looking for signs of hope for Ukraines future, I also think of hope as it applies to matters here at home.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Biden Bans Russian Oil
description: President Biden announced a ban on imports of Russian oil and natural gas into the U.S., an escalation of economic penalties that could have consequences at home and around the world.

title: He Spent $57,000 in Covid Relief on a Pokmon Card. Now the U.S. Owns It.
description: The forfeitures have included Lamborghinis, gold bars and luxury goods from Dior.

title: Homeland Security Dept. gathered millions of money transfer records, senator says.
description: The Department of Homeland Security collected records on millions of money transfers between people in Mexico and four American states in what Senator Ron Wyden said amounted to a secret bulk surveillance program.

title: The Feel-Good Savings in Gov. Murphys Budget
description: The New Jersey governor's budget proposal is focused on providing savings for residents.

title: Weight Watchers App Gathered Data From Children, F.T.C. Says
description: WW International, the weight-loss organization formerly known as Weight Watchers, used an app to illegally collect personal information from children without their parents permission, the Federal Trade Commission said.

title: Seahawks Plan to Trade Russell Wilson to the Broncos
description: Russell Wilson, the face of the Seattle Seahawks for the past decade, is expected to head to Denver as part of a multi-player trade with the Broncos.

title: Ukrainians Trying to Flee to U.K. Face a Confounding Path
description: LONDON  Charlotte Shevchenko-Knight flipped through old family photo albums and toured the snowy neighborhoods of the Ukrainian capital when she visited her grandparents in Kyiv in January.

title: Aaron Rodgers, fined by the N.F.L. over vaccination rules, says he will stay with the Packers.
description: Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers, a four-time N.F.L. most valuable player, has agreed to remain with the team, concluding his yearlong back-and-forth with the club about his future.

title: As Fighting Gets Closer, a Kyiv Hospital Treats the Wars Atrocities
description: KYIV, Ukraine  A grim scene awaited Dr. Oleksandr Sherbina as he made the rounds of Clinical Hospital No. 7, a medical facility that once specialized in treating strokes but is now suddenly immersed in the atrocities of war. As he passed the operating theater, surgeons were amputating the lower leg of a wounded Ukrainian soldier.

title: Iran Nuclear Deal Nears Completion, but Russia Poses Complication
description: BRUSSELS  With negotiators all but finished with their work to restore the 2015 nuclear deal with Iran, the Russian invasion of Ukraine has made an agreement both more urgent and more difficult to get.

title: Texas Youth Gender Clinic Closed Last Year Under Political Pressure
description: On a tense conference call last November with half a dozen doctors and executives at the University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center, Dr. John Warner relayed a somber message: The only specialty clinic in the state to treat transgender adolescents was facing unrelenting political pressure to close.

title: Reggaetons Global Expansion and Wide-Open Future
description: The current generation of reggaeton superstars  J Balvin, Rauw Alejandro, Farruko and more  find themselves in constant dialogue with pop, EDM and hip-hop, and have become ambitious ambassadors of cultural exchange. As the genre is growing in global popularity, it is also stratifying into subsets, some leaning toward the synthetic and some returning to roots.

title: How Do You Feel About U.S. Mask Mandates Lifting?
description: Mask mandates are quickly being lifted across the United States as Omicron cases have receded and Covid-19 deaths have fallen.

title: Watchdog Sees Cover-Up in Failure to Report Rikers Island Beatings
description: Louis A. Molina, the commissioner of the New York City Department of Correction, was harshly criticized on Tuesday by a jails oversight panel for his agencys failure to document two brutal beatings that occurred on Rikers Island last year.

title: What Opportunities Did Covid Steal From You?
description: The pandemic upended the global economy, shut down capitals and statehouses, and devastated businesses. But along with these major disruptions came smaller, more personal derailments.

title: Taylor Tomlinson: A Comic With the Confidence of a Star
description: The moment I knew that the stand-up comic Taylor Tomlinson was going to be a star was not after she made the precociously funny debut special, Quarter-Life Crisis, at the age of 25. Or her assured follow-up, Look at You, which premiered on Netflix this week. Or even after the news that shes writing and starring in a movie about her own life (directed by Paul Weitz).

title: An Olympic Marathoners Journey From Kenya to the Front Lines in Ukraine
description: ITEN, Kenya  The Ukrainian marathoner Mykola Nyzhnyk was asleep in the Kenyan countryside on Feb. 24 when he received a call from his pregnant wife, Olga. Alone in their apartment in Brovary, roughly 13 miles from Kyiv, shed heard two explosions, so strong that the windows were shaking, she said. Ten minutes later, a third blast drowned out the piercing siren of car alarms, and she described a growing cloud of smoke in the distance.

title: In the Foothills of Los Angeles, a Celebration of Renewal
description: Since 2002, Humberto Leon and Carol Lim have run their trendsetting label Opening Ceremony more like a social club than a clothing line. People often come to the brand through an event or a party we throw, says Lim from the patio of Chifa, a 1980s-inflected Chinese Peruvian restaurant, with zebra-print walls and a big heart-shaped picture window, that Leon designed with the architect Michael Loverich. Its a cool mid-February evening on the 15th and final day of Lunar New Year celebrations, and the pairs loved ones have gathered in the glow of a full moon, in the cozy, vibrant Los Angeles neighborhood of Eagle Rock, to observe the Lantern Festival, a closing ceremony of sorts that symbolizes rebirth and promotes good fortune.

title: Brittney Griners Impact Is Clear as W.N.B.A. Fans Await Word From Russia
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Tiny Love Stories: I Really Didnt Want to Hurt Her
description: Durian. Its love or hate with this fruit. In my family, only Grandma and I were fans. Because of its pungent odor, my family members with milder tastes made a house rule: Durian must be consumed in the parking lot or playground, never indoors. Indignant and banished, I found comfort in Grandmas solidarity. Together, wed wolf down the divisive fruit, reveling in its strong taste and frozen flesh. Now, whenever I feel outcast, my fellow durian warrior inspires courage. I remember looking up at Grandma, chowing down in Hong Kongs sweltering heat with a satisfied smirk, honoring her own taste.  Jocelyn Ming Hei Chan

title: A Reading Crisis
description: Since the beginning of the pandemic, Dana Goldstein, who covers education for The Times, has been hearing from parents concerned that their young childrens language development might have been hindered by masks in the classroom.

title: U.S. Bans Russian Oil
description: Good evening. This is your Russia-Ukraine War Briefing, a weeknight guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: PGA Tour Commissioner Has Strong Words for Phil Mickelson
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla.  In his first meeting with reporters since Phil Mickelsons controversial remarks about offering assistance to an upstart Saudi-backed golf league, Jay Monahan, the PGA Tour commissioner, said on Tuesday that he had not talked with Mickelson but that he did not absolve him from future punishment for his comments.

title: Central Park Brush Fires May Have Been Deliberately Set, Officials Say
description: A series of brush and trash fires in a wooded area of Central Park that blanketed the Manhattan sky with thick smoke Tuesday appeared to have been deliberately set, officials said.

title: Conrad Janis, Father on Mork & Mindy and Much More, Dies at 94
description: Conrad Janis, an actor familiar to television viewers as Mindys father on the hit sitcom Mork & Mindy who was also a skilled jazz musician and a gallerist well known in the New York art world, died on March 1 in Los Angeles. He was 94.

title: Another Marathon Day Ends With No M.L.B. Agreement
description: Seven days after Major League Baseball Commissioner Rob Manfred canceled a week of regular season games because the league didnt have a labor agreement with players in place to start the 2022 season, M.L.B. gave the players union a new deadline, with a slightly different position than before.

title: Biden Offers More Free Covid Tests Although Demand Has Slowed
description: WASHINGTON  The Biden administration on Tuesday formally began allowing Americans who had ordered free coronavirus tests this winter to request a second round of four tests per household, through the same U.S. Postal Service program that President Biden unveiled in January.

title: Review: In Jane Anger, Revenge Is a Thorny Uphill Climb
description: In Jane Anger, a new comedy by Talene Monahon, everyone is fed up with the endless waves of sickness and quarantine. The year is 1606, and we are in England, which is enduring another outbreak of the plague. But for one man, a late-career William Shakespeare, there are graver concerns: writers block.

title: Hawaii will end its mask mandate this month as cases subside.
description: Hawaii on Tuesday became the 50th and final state to announce that it will drop its universal indoor mask mandate as the United States tries to move on from the once ferocious Omicron wave.

title: Masking helped protect children from the virus last fall, a C.D.C. study suggests.
description: More and more American school districts have dropped mask mandates in recent weeks as coronavirus cases plunged across the United States. But they remain a subject of debate among some students and their parents, and a study released on Tuesday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention suggested that those mandates had helped protect children and teachers from the coronavirus last fall.

title: Congress Approves Legislation to Return the Postal Service to Solvency
description: WASHINGTON  Congress gave final approval on Tuesday to the most sprawling overhaul of the Postal Service in nearly two decades, sending President Biden legislation intended to return the beleaguered agency to solvency and address pandemic-era mail delays.

title: Edmund Keeley Dies at 94; Shined a Light on Modern Greek Culture
description: Edmund Keeley, who as a novelist, translator, scholar and poet brought an appreciation of modern Greek literature and culture to the English-speaking world, died on Feb. 23 at his home in Princeton, N.J. He was 94.

title: The W.H.O. strengthens its booster endorsement but still emphasizes getting primary shots to more people.
description: The World Health Organization offered a more full-throated endorsement of booster shots of coronavirus vaccines on Tuesday than it previously had, though it continued to emphasize the importance of increasing access to initial doses in parts of the world that have been left behind in vaccination efforts.

title: Venezuela Releases Imprisoned Americans After Talks With U.S.
description: Venezuelas authoritarian government on Tuesday released at least two imprisoned Americans, a potential turning point in the Biden administrations relationship with Russias staunchest ally in the Western Hemisphere.

title: From the Left, a Historians Plea for Democratic Party Unity
description: The Democratic Party is going through one of its periodic convulsions, with an insurgent left battling for pre-eminence over a centrist establishment led by President Biden.

title: Putin Has No Good Way Out, and That Really Scares Me
description: If youre hoping that the instability that Vladimir Putins war on Ukraine has wreaked on global markets and geopolitics has peaked, your hope is in vain. We havent seen anything yet. Wait until Putin fully grasps that his only choices left in Ukraine are how to lose  early and small and a little humiliated or late and big and deeply humiliated.

title: New Rules for a New World
description: Russias invasion of Ukraine is being described as the end of the post-Cold War era. This isnt quite accurate. Since the Soviet Union collapsed in 1991, weve seen three different eras. Each of them lasted about a decade.

title: Food Companies, Long Symbols of the West in Russia, Pause Operations
description: When McDonalds opened its doors in Moscows Pushkin Square in 1990, it was welcomed by more than 30,000 Russians who happily waited hours in line, eager to spend a sizable chunk of their daily wages for a taste of America.

title: In Texas, Biden Says New Legislation Could Expand Benefits for Burn Pit Victims
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden called on Tuesday for the broad expansion of health benefits for veterans, particularly those who fell ill after breathing in toxic materials from burning waste in the Iraq and Afghanistan wars, exposure that he believes contributed to the cancer that killed his elder son, Beau.

title: Spy Agencies Cite Russias Setbacks but Say Putin Is Unlikely to Be Deterred
description: WASHINGTON  Top U.S. intelligence officials said on Tuesday that President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia had been surprised and unsettled by the problems that have hampered his military in Ukraine, issues that will make it more difficult for Russian forces to control the country.

title: Pressing for Evidence, Jan. 6 Panel Argues That Trump Committed Fraud
description: WASHINGTON  The House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol on Tuesday laid out its theory for potential criminal charges against former President Donald J. Trump, arguing before a federal judge that he and the conservative lawyer John C. Eastman were involved in a conspiracy to perpetrate a fraud on the American public as part of a plan to overturn the 2020 election.

title: Quoting Churchill and Shakespeare, Ukraine Leader Vows No Surrender
description: LONDON  With Ukraines outgunned army holding firm despite Russian bombardments that have displaced millions of civilians, the war in Ukraine has become a grim spectacle of resistance, no one more defiant than the countrys president, Volodymyr Zelensky, who vowed on Tuesday never to give in to Russias tanks, troops or artillery shells.

title: Corrections: March 9, 2022
description: Because of an editing error, an article on Tuesday about internet blockages in Russia misspelled the surname of an Oxford University researcher. He is Aliaksandr Herasimenka, not Herasmenka.

title: Mark Meadows Spread Trumps Voter Fraud Claims. Now His Voting Record Is Under Scrutiny.
description: Mark Meadows, the White House chief of staff who helped former President Donald J. Trump spread false claims of voter fraud in an attempt to overturn the results of the 2020 election, is facing questions about his own voting record, following a report that he registered to vote from a North Carolina mobile home where he did not live.

title: Biden Bans Oil Imports From Russia, Calling It a Blow to Putins War Machine
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden on Tuesday banned imports of Russian oil, gas and coal in response to what he called President Vladimir V. Putins vicious war of choice in Ukraine, but warned Americans that the decision to inflict economic pain on Russia would inevitably mean higher gas prices at home.

title: Californians may get tax rebate to combat soaring fuel prices.
description: As political leaders across the country scramble to address soaring gas prices, Gov. Gavin Newsom of California announced on Tuesday that he would seek to give residents relief.

title: Much of Smartmatic Case Against Fox News Can Proceed, Judge Rules
description: The $2.7 billion defamation lawsuit against Fox News by the election technology company Smartmatic can move forward, a New York judge ruled on Tuesday. But the judge tossed out Smartmatics defamation claims against the Fox News host Jeanine Pirro and a network guest, Sidney Powell.

title: Quotation of the Day: Pandemic Has Pulled Reading Skills Down Into New Territory
description: That feeling of guilt comes over me. What about the kids in the Bronx?

title: Zverevs Swings Merited More Than a Slap on the Wrist
description: SAN DIEGO  Somehow, the mens tennis tour is allowing the German star Alexander Zverev to play on. He will be in the field for the BNP Paribas Open, which begins this week in Indian Wells, Calif., despite his frightening, unacceptable abuse of an official just two weeks ago after a defeat in doubles in Acapulco, Mexico.

title: Often in Italian
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  This is Peter Gordons 124th New York Times Crossword puzzle, and its a silly one! Wordplay that involves wacky phrases and clues is one of my favorite theme types, and this puzzle definitely checks that box.

title: Review: The Chinese Lady Casts a Long Look at Hate
description: Afong Moy is known as The Chinese Lady, but really she is just a girl  14 when she arrives alone in New York in 1834, brought by a pair of merchant brothers who struck a deal with her father in China to put her in a museum for two years, on display.

title: Woman Hid Moscow Ties While Pushing I Love Russia Propaganda, U.S. Says
description: A woman who led an I Love Russia propaganda campaign in the United States as a citizen of both countries was charged on Tuesday with flouting federal law by failing to register as an agent of a foreign government, prosecutors said.

title: Attack on Turkish Restaurant Lands Two Men in Prison
description: Two California men were sentenced this week to federal prison terms for attacking five employees of a Turkish restaurant in Beverly Hills, Calif., in November 2020 because of their anger at Turkeys support of Azerbaijan in its conflict with Armenia, federal prosecutors said on Tuesday.

title: Yoon Suk-yeol helped prosecute presidents. Now he wants to be one.
description: As a star prosecutor, Yoon Suk-yeol, the leading conservative candidate, helped imprison two former presidents as well as the head of Samsung and a former chief justice of the countrys Supreme Court on charges of corruption.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: President Biden banned imports of Russian oil, gas and coal to the U.S. in response to what he called a vicious war of choice in Ukraine by Vladimir Putin, the Russian leader. Biden warned Americans that the decision to inflict economic pain on Russia would inevitably mean higher gas prices at home. Defending freedom is going to cost, he said in televised remarks.

title: Lee Jae-myung is a technocrat with hardscrabble origins.
description: South Koreas leading liberal candidate, Lee Jae-myung, started his presidential bid with a speech that spoke squarely to the countrys simmering angst and its struggling middle class.

title: How the War in Ukraine Hurt a Gas Station Owner on Long Island
description: Good morning. Its Wednesday. Well look at gasoline stations in the New York area that are under pressure because of Russias invasion of Ukraine. Well also find out about a tree in Miami Beach with a guardian in SoHo.

title: Jimmy Fallon Rags on Americas Gas Problem
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Word of the Day: canny
description: The word canny has appeared in 108 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Feb. 20 in At Billie Eilishs Arena Show, the Only Spectacle Is Herself by Lindsay Zoladz:

title: At the Bottom of an Icy Sea, One of Historys Great Wrecks Is Found
description: The wreck of Endurance has been found in the Antarctic, 106 years after the historic ship was crushed in pack ice and sank during an expedition by the explorer Ernest Shackleton.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: WEDNESDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Republicans, Once Harsh Ukraine Critics, Pivot to Strong Support
description: WASHINGTON  In the final years of Donald J. Trumps presidency, Republicans portrayed Ukraine as an Eastern European Wild West run by nefarious oligarchs and unlawful politicians, a bad actor that sought to tamper in American elections and channel millions of dollars to Joseph R. Biden Jr.s son.

title: Loss of Russian Oil Leaves a Void Not Easily Filled, Straining Market
description: HOUSTON  Before its forces invaded Ukraine, Russia provided one out of every 10 barrels of oil the world consumed. But as the United States and other customers shun Russian crude, the global oil market faces its greatest upheaval since the Middle East tumult of the 1970s.

title: What Do Women Need Now?
description: PARIS  The fall 2022 ready-to-wear shows came to an end on International Womens Day; a useful reminder, really, of what this is all ultimately about. Even given everything else that is going on. Maybe especially given everything else that is going on.

title: The Most Size-Inclusive Brand at Fashion Week
description: Theres a lot to see at fashion week. Blink (or scroll too fast) and youll miss the details: feathered bags, futuristic sunglasses, fork jewelry. All month long, well spotlight the things we saw that surprised or delighted us.

title: Newly Published, From the Birth of Hip-Hop to Elena Ferrante
description: ULYSSES, by James Joyce. (Folio, $795.) With illustrations by John Vernon Lord, this extravagant edition of 500 copies celebrates the novels 100th anniversary.

title: Bacon, Gas and Essentials: Where 2,200 Americans Have Noticed Inflation
description: Nearly nine in 10 Americans say they have noticed prices rising around them. And, when asked which of the price increases have caught their attention, many mentioned basic necessities.

title: A Brick on an Egg
description: What do you think this image is saying? How does it relate to or comment on society or current events? Can you relate to it personally? What is your opinion of its message?

title: What Is Your Relationship Like With Your Grandparents and Elders?
description: Have you had close relationships with grandparents or other elders during your life? What memories come to mind when you think of them?

title: The New Phase of the Pandemic Is Covid Exhaustion
description: This article is part of Times Opinions reflection on the two year mark of the coronavirus pandemic. Read more in a note from Alexandra Sifferlin, Opinions health and science editor, in our Opinion Today newsletter.

title: There Are Glimmers of Hope for Biden. Or Maybe Slivers.
description: Despite the terrible reality of the war in Ukraine, rising inflation and record gas prices, a faint ray of sunshine has fallen on Joe Biden and the Democratic Party. According to strategists for both parties, the Democrats now have a 50-50 chance of retaining control of the Senate in the midterm elections, crucial for the appointment of federal judges, but nowhere near enough electoral strength to give them a shot at keeping their House majority.

title: Changed Itineraries, Higher Fares: How the War in Ukraine Is Affecting Travel
description: Just as the travel industry was seeking to climb out of a two-year depression, Russias assault on Ukraine has scrambled schedules and given Americans pause as they consider international vacations.

title: We Will Forget Much of the Pandemic. Thats a Good Thing.
description: This article is part of Times Opinions reflection on the two-year mark of the Covid pandemic. Read more in a note from Alexandra Sifferlin, Opinions health and science editor, in our Opinion Today newsletter.

title: Sex-Trafficking Couple Exploited Foster Care Loophole, Officials Say
description: When Sharice Mitchell became a foster parent early in 2019, she told the officials responsible for vetting her that she was separated from her husband and had not been in contact with him for more than a year.

title: Tying and Re-Tying the Knot
description: Read more about the 2022 wedding boom in our ongoing Year of the Wedding series.

title: New Yorks First Supertall Tower Outside Manhattan Rises in Brooklyn
description: Near the top of the 1,066-foot Brooklyn Tower in Downtown Brooklyn, wind whipped across the unfinished concrete slab, and the developer, Michael Stern, showcased the stunning, sky-high views.

title: With The Godfather, Art Imitated Mafia Life. And Vice Versa.
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Empty Stores and an Exodus: Hong Kongs Covid Crackdown Stirs Panic
description: HONG KONG  As the government in Hong Kong struggles to contain the citys worst Covid outbreak ever, some residents have panicked. They have emptied supermarket shelves of vegetables and meat. They have raided drugstores for pain and fever medication. Those who could afford it have jumped on flights out of the city.

title: Elizabeth Holmess Ex-Boyfriend Hopes to Escape the Verdict She Didnt
description: Elizabeth Holmes was a star entrepreneur whose trial for defrauding investors in her blood-testing start-up became one of the biggest Silicon Valley spectacles since the introduction of the iPhone. Her conviction in January marked a rare moment in the boastful history of technology: A chief executive was held criminally responsible for lying.

title: Lesson of the Day: How Long Covid Exhausts the Body
description: Featured Article: How Long Covid Exhausts the Body by Josh Keller

title: The Godfather Explained in Seven Quotes
description: When Francis Ford Coppolas The Godfather opened in New York on March 15, 1972, critics immediately understood the mob family drama to be a masterpiece. But they could not have foreseen how some of the dialogue would become part of our collective memory, often turning into catchphrases divorced from the film itself. In honor of the 50th anniversary of The Godfather, we asked seven fans  critics, actors, directors  to look back at Don Vito Corleone, sons Sonny and Michael, and henchmen like Clemenza and Tom Hagen, to reflect on key lines.

title: Al Pacino on The Godfather: Its Taken Me a Lifetime to Accept It and Move On
description: Its hard to imagine The Godfather without Al Pacino. His understated performance as Michael Corleone, who became a respectable war hero despite his corrupt family, goes almost unnoticed for the first hour of the film  until at last he asserts himself, gradually taking control of the Corleone criminal operation and the film along with it.

title: Weekly Accessible Learning Activities: Peat, Coin Collecting, Civil Rights
description: Each Wednesday we shine a spotlight on five student activities that support a broad range of learners. In this weeks roundup of accessible activities, we invite students to learn about the environmental benefits of peat, share the things they love to collect, watch a film about the 10th anniversary of Trayvon Martins death, talk about their experiences doing D.I.Y. projects, and make observations about a photograph.

title: Ill Say It Again: Theres More Than One Way to Raise Kids Who Thrive
description: The parenting method RIE  that stands for Resources for Infant Educarers and is pronounced rye  and its most famous practitioner, Janet Lansbury, are having another high-profile moment, with interviews this year by Ezra Klein in The Times and Ariel Levy in The New Yorker. And because Im old and cranky and have been on the parenting beat for a minute, my gut response to this resurgence is: Again? I remember RIEs previous moments in the sun, with features in Vanity Fair in 2014 and The Daily Beast in 2017.

title: Will Banning Russian Oil Hurt Russia, or the U.S.?
description: On Tuesday morning, President Biden took to the podium at the White House to deliver a solemn and provocative speech. As punishment for waging war on Ukraine, he announced, the United States would cut off Russian oil imports.

title: Biden Takes Step Toward Regulating Cryptocurrencies
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden signed an executive order on Wednesday directing the federal government to come up with a plan to regulate cryptocurrencies, recognizing their popularity and potential to destabilize traditional finance.

title: A man who bought a Pokmon card for $57,000 with Covid relief money is sentenced to prison.
description: The forfeitures have included Lamborghinis, gold bars and luxury goods from Dior.

title: Australia Is Getting Harder to Live In: Unending Rain, Growing Floods
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Australias prime minister declared a national emergency on Wednesday as more than a week of severe rain along the countrys eastern coast has caused some of the worst flooding in Australian history and inundated swaths of two of its largest cities.

title: Do Covid Precautions Work?
description: Daily life in red and blue America has continued to be quite different over the past few months. Its a reflection of the partisan divide over Covid-19. Consider:

title: Russias Other Contest With the West: Economic Endurance
description: As Russias invasion of Ukraine grinds on, Moscow is finding itself mired in a parallel conflict: a contest of economic and political endurance against the West.

title: Russias ruble continues its slide as new curbs restrict access to foreign currency.
description: Russia's currency continued its descent on Wednesday as trading in the ruble was restarted on the Moscow Exchange. But in an effort to stanch the currencys decline, the Russian central bank issued an order further restricting access to U.S. dollars.

title: Severe Weather Helps Contain Florida Wildfires
description: A series of severe storms and substantial rainfall on Wednesday helped firefighters in the Florida Panhandle in their efforts to contain wildfires that are threatening nearby communities, officials said.

title: A New Iron Curtain Is Falling
description: Each day brings more economic punishments for Russia after its invasion of Ukraine. The sudden isolation of the Russian economy is striking in its speed and scope.

title: Ukraines first lady emerges into the spotlight to condemn Russias invasion and plead for help.
description: LVIV, Ukraine  As her husband has become a global symbol of leadership in the face of Russias invasion, Ukraines first lady, Olena Zelenska, has taken on a less public role. But on Tuesday evening, she emerged into the media spotlight, sending an open letter that she said was her testimony from Ukraine.

title: How Air Pollution Across America Reflects Racist Policy From the 1930s
description: Urban neighborhoods that were redlined by federal officials in the 1930s tended to have higher levels of harmful air pollution eight decades later, a new study has found, adding to a body of evidence that reveals how racist policies in the past have contributed to inequalities across the United States today.

title: A Perch Over the Caribbean Sea on Tortola Island
description: This four-bedroom hillside property with Atlantic Ocean views on the coast of Tortola, in the British Virgin Islands, is for sale for $1.85 million.

title: House Hunting in the Virgin Islands: Hillside Splendor for Under $2 Million
description: This four-bedroom villa with Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea views sits on a hillside on the northwest coast of Tortola, in the British Virgin Islands.

title: Djokovic Says He wont Attend U.S. Tournaments Over Vaccination Status
description: Novak Djokovic, one of the worlds most prominent sports stars to hold out against getting a coronavirus vaccination, was included in the field for this weeks Indian Wells tennis tournament in Southern California, but said Wednesday that he cant enter the United States and wont participate.

title: Netanyahu tests positive for the virus.
description: JERUSALEM  Benjamin Netanyahu, the former prime minister of Israel, tested positive for the coronavirus on Wednesday, according to a statement from his conservative Likud party.

title: Why California Gas Prices Are Especially High
description: The price of gasoline in the United States reached a new high on Tuesday at $4.173 per gallon, surpassing the previous high set in July 2008.

title: Radio Drama for a Podcast Age: How Amazons Audible Moved Into Theater
description: Elizabeth Marvel took off her shoes, stretched out her arms and started describing her horrible dreams. Ato Blankson-Wood offered thoughts on astrology. Bill Camp, cradling a guitar in his lap, asked if someone could go get coffee, while Jason Bowen adjusted his chair.

title: What You Get for $900,000
description: A 1912 Greek Revival house in Hopewell, Va.; a four-bedroom home near New Orleans; and a three-bedroom duplex in Jersey City, N.J.

title: $900,000 Homes in Virginia, Louisiana and New Jersey
description: This house, known as Miami Lodge, has been owned by the same family for 60 years. Aside from fresh paint and updated structural systems, it has remained virtually unchanged since it was built more than 100 years ago.

title: How Well Do You Know The Godfather? The Quiz Nobody Asked For
description: Accept this quiz as a gift for the films 50th anniversary.

title: Assassinated in His Prime, an Iconic African Leader Haunts a Trial and His Country
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Burkina Faso  Decades later, the scene of the crime is still intact: a deserted building of cracked windowpanes and dust-blown corridors, its courtyard strewn with withered leaves. Gunfire erupted here in October 1987 as Thomas Sankara, the 37-year-old president of Burkina Faso, was meeting with six aides.

title: Leslie Jones Gets Revved Up by Vinyl, Live Tweeting and Euphoria
description: I was in as soon as they said, Black pirate, Leslie Jones recalled about the offer to play Spanish Jackie in the HBO Max series Our Flag Means Death.

title: Punk Rocks New Hope: The Ferocious, Joyful Linda Lindas
description: PIONEERTOWN, Calif. Kids to the front! the drummer shouted.

title: Patient in Groundbreaking Heart Transplant Dies
description: The first person to have his failing heart replaced with that of a genetically altered pig in a groundbreaking operation died Tuesday afternoon at the University of Maryland Medical Center, two months after the transplant surgery.

title: Biden offers more free coronavirus tests although demand has slowed.
description: The Biden administration on Tuesday formally began allowing Americans who had ordered free coronavirus tests this winter to request a second round of four tests per household, through the same U.S. Postal Service program that President Biden unveiled in January.

title: How Western Firms Quietly Enabled Russian Oligarchs
description: Behind a set of imposing metal doors in an easy-to-miss office building in a New York City suburb, a small team manages billions of dollars for a Russian oligarch.

title: Here Are Some of the Companies That Have Pledged to Stop Business in Russia
description: After the Russian president, Vladimir V. Putin, ordered the invasion of Ukraine on Feb. 24, multinational companies have been forced to re-examine their ties with Russia. Some, like McDonalds, PepsiCo and Shell, had built relationships with the country over decades and were faced with untangling complicated deals.

title: Where Fashion Stylists Shop for Vintage
description: One afternoon in late February, the owners of the new Lower East Side vintage boutique Desert Vintage were musing about their customers. Our clientele will wear Philo-era Celine trousers with an Edwardian top, said Salima Boufelfel, who owns the shop with her partner, Roberto Cowan. Its never just 90s Prada or a turn-of-the-century lace collar. Its the mix of these different elements that tell a larger story. Its a mash-up.

title: Sell My Soul and Hopefully Start Over With a New One.
description: The novelist Sheila Heti puts her diary in alphabetical order to see if shes changed over the years.

title: Prepping for St. Patricks Day
description: Good morning. Its a project to be sure, but maybe you should take the approaching St. Patricks Day holiday on March 17 as a chance to corn your own beef, and then to use the meat in whatever way pleases you most: for corned beef and cabbage, say, or Irish tacos (above). The process yields incredible flavor, far beyond anything you can get out of the briskets in that tub at the grocery store, and its deeply rewarding to boot. Get started as soon as you can.

title: Employers are still scrambling to fill vacancies, a new U.S. report shows.
description: Job openings in the United States and the number of workers quitting their jobs remained near record highs in January, an indicator of demand for labor and of worker leverage.

title: Living In ... Englewood, N.J.
description: The Bergen County city combines an urban vibe with the hilly terrain and residential neighborhoods of a smaller town, just a few miles from Manhattan.

title: Englewood, N.J.: A Cosmopolitan Suburb Close to the City
description: With three children under 5, and a fourth on the way, Elizabeth and Alan Mitrani were more than ready to move out of their one-bedroom apartment in New York City, where their living room doubled as a nursery.

title: The Conference Champion Not Going to the N.C.A.A. Tournament
description: In college basketballs midmajor leagues, winning the conference tournament is often the only dependable way for a team to secure an N.C.A.A. tournament bid.

title: A House panel calls for a criminal investigation into Amazon.
description: A House committee asked the Justice Department on Wednesday to investigate Amazon and some of its executives for criminal obstruction of a congressional investigation that included the e-commerce giant.

title: Cities and States Are Easing Covid Rules. Should the Arts Follow?
description: When music fans walked beneath the familiar piano-shaped awning and into the dark embrace of the Blue Note Jazz Club in Greenwich Village this week, a late-pandemic fixture was missing: No one was checking proof of vaccination and photo IDs.

title: Are You an Astier Person?
description: On a trip to New York about a decade ago, Benot Astier de Villatte and Ivan Pericoli stopped at ABC Carpet & Home in Manhattan. The store was among the first to stock ceramics from Astier de Villatte, the line the men co-founded in Paris in 1996. They were admiring how some of their dishes were displayed when a salesclerk told them the pieces were copies of those used by Marie Antoinette.

title: They Predicted the Ukraine War. But Did They Still Get It Wrong?
description: Its a curious feature of Western debate since Russias invasion of Ukraine that a school of thought that predicted some version of this conflict has been depicted as discredited by the partial fulfillment of its prophecies.

title: No Ikea Shelves, No Levis: The Retail Exodus From Russia Is On
description: On Monday, the chief financial officer of Stanley Black & Decker told investors that the company was still figuring out whether it was going to keep its business in Russia given new sanctions affecting the country, or exit in coming weeks or months.

title: Fiction With a Covid Theme: Will It Sell?
description: To the Editor:

title: Geffen Halls $550 Million Makeover Is Fully Funded
description: Gone are the mustard-colored seats and shoe box interior of David Geffen Hall, the New York Philharmonics home at Lincoln Center. When the hall reopens this fall, wavy beech wood will wrap around the stage  and so will the audience, in seats upholstered in richly colored patterns evoking flower petals in motion.

title: Woman Is an Ambitious Attempt to Capture Four Centuries of Being Female
description: Weve come a long way, baby.

title: An Artist and Met Museum Guard Whose New Work Is About Pay: Her Own
description: For decades Emilie Lemakis has made art rooted in the experiences and ephemera of her daily life.

title: Sharks Sleep, Even When Both Eyes Are Wide Open
description: Sharks are celebrated for their apparently ceaseless motion  a small handful of species such as great white sharks must even swim to breathe, keeping water washing over their gills. Still, all that moving doesnt preclude sharks from having a rest. Sleep across the animal kingdom manifests itself in many peculiar ways, like the birds whose brains sleep one half at a time or the bats that spend almost every hour of their day snoozing.

title: Videos show devastating strike at Mariupol hospital maternity ward.
description: An apparent Russian strike on Wednesday damaged and destroyed buildings at a hospital complex in the southern Ukrainian city of Mariupol, including a maternity ward, according to several videos verified by The New York Times.

title: With Humor, and a Nod to History, Johnson and Zelensky Find a Rapport
description: LONDON  When President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine thanked British lawmakers for their solidarity in an emotional video address to the House of Commons on Tuesday evening, he singled out a particular member watching him raptly from the frontbench: Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

title: New Yorkers With Marijuana Convictions Will Get First Retail Licenses
description: ALBANY, N.Y.  New York State will soon announce plans to usher in its first outlets for retail sales of marijuana by the end of the year, giving applicants access to stockpiles of the drug grown by local farmers and offering sweeteners like new storefronts leased by the state.

title: Tony Awards to Announce Prizes in June at Radio City Music Hall
description: This years Tony Awards will take place on June 12 at Radio City Music Hall as the theater industry seeks to settle in to some sort of new normal following the enormous disruption of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Will Russias Isolation Last?
description: Many international businesses in tech and other industries are stopping work in Russia after the invasion of Ukraine.

title: Austria Does a U-Turn on Mandatory Vaccinations, Citing Milder Variant Cases
description: BERLIN  Four months ago, Austria made headlines when it announced plans to become the first Western democracy to impose a general vaccine mandate to fight the coronavirus, a measure that would have hit adults who refused to be inoculated with fines of up to 3,600 euros (about $4,000).

title: Who Will Win This Years Wild Best Actress Race?
description: The best actress category is doing the most.

title: Volodymyr Zelensky Is Playing the Role of His Life
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Biden Restores Californias Power to Set Stringent Tailpipe Rules
description: WASHINGTON  The Biden administration on Wednesday restored Californias legal authority to set auto pollution and mileage rules that are tighter than federal standards, a potent climate policy that had been stripped away by former President Donald J. Trump.

title: Australia Declares National Emergency Amid Severe Flooding
description: Scott Morrison, the prime minister of Australia, said the deadly downpours that forced thousands of people to evacuate the nations eastern coast are making the country harder to live in.

title: Review: The Virtuoso Sara Mearns Considers Other Virtuosities
description: Sara Mearns is a go-for-broke dancer. As a star of New York City Ballet, she dances on a thrillingly huge scale, combining the drama of risk and abandon with the drama of glamour and emotion. But she has realized that there are other kinds of virtuosity, and in recent years she has been exploring them with the same headlong energy.

title: Colorado County Clerk Indicted in Voting Security Breach Investigation
description: Tina Peters, a county clerk running as a Republican for secretary of state of Colorado, was indicted Tuesday evening on 10 criminal counts related to allegations that she tampered with election equipment after the 2020 election.

title: How a Playground for the Rich Could Undermine Sanctions on Oligarchs
description: Stretching into the Persian Gulf from the beaches and skyscrapers of Dubai is a man-made archipelago in the shape of a vast palm tree, its branchlike rows of islands lined with luxury hotels, apartments and villas.

title: Scotland Apologizes for History of Witchcraft Persecution
description: The persecution began in the 1500s and lasted almost two centuries. Nearly 4,000 people were accused of witchcraft, a vast majority of them women. They were arrested, brutally tortured and coerced into false confessions. Two-thirds of those accused were executed, according to historians.

title: C.E.O.s Are Going Out of Their Way to Punish Russia
description: Companies arent just complying with government sanctions imposed on Russia in response to its invasion of Ukraine. In many cases theyre going beyond whats required. Last Friday, Shell bought 100,000 metric tons of Russian crude oil at a record discount, a fantastic bargain that would ordinarily be cause for celebration at the company. Not with blood being shed in Ukraine, though. On Tuesday, Shells chief executive officer, Ben van Beurden, apologized, even though the purchase didnt violate sanctions.

title: Moving Through the Lens
description: Like many successful romances, the one between the model and photographer Guinevere van Seenus and the writer and podcaster Beau Friedlander had a middle man: Ms. van Seenuss three-legged dog, Ashley.

title: After a Week of Siege, Bloodied Mariupol Plans Mass Graves
description: LVIV, Ukraine  Marina Levinchuk said she received an alarming text message from the local authorities in the besieged city of Mariupol several days ago, before she decided to flee. If somebody dies in your family, she said, recalling the message in her own words, just put the body outside, cover it, tie up the hands and the legs and leave it outside.

title: Disney C.E.O. Says Company Is Opposed to Floridas Dont Say Gay Bill
description: It was a bruised Bob Chapek who arrived at Disneys annual shareholder meeting on Wednesday  and all because of a crisis of his own making.

title: I Must Save My Mom: The Women Returning to Ukraine
description: As millions seek to escape Russias invasion of Ukraine, 200,000 people have gone the other way, toward the fighting. Many are women, risking the dangers of war to rescue relatives or defend their homes.

title: Richard Sherman Pleads Guilty to Charges From Family Altercation
description: The free-agent N.F.L. cornerback Richard Sherman pleaded guilty to two misdemeanors on Monday, resolving charges from last summer when he was arrested after police said he drunkenly crashed his car and tried to break down the door of his in-laws home in Redmond, Wash., a suburb outside of Seattle.

title: Republicans Wrongly Blame Biden for Rising Gas Prices
description: WASHINGTON  As gas prices hit a high this week, top Republican lawmakers took to the airwaves and the floors of Congress with misleading claims that pinned the blame on President Biden and his energy policies.

title: Kent Waldrep, Athlete Whose Injury Led to Advocacy, Dies at 67
description: Kent Waldrep, a former college running back whose paralyzing injury in a 1974 game led to a life of activism in which he served with a federal agency that recommended enactment of the Americans With Disabilities Act and raised millions of dollars for spinal cord research, died on Feb. 27 in Natchitoches, La. He was 67.

title: Twitter Bot Highlights Gender Pay Gap One Company at a Time
description: Each International Womens Day, photos of smiling women appear in a steady stream on social media alongside testimonials from brands eager to show their support for gender equality.

title: A Ukrainian School in New York Takes on a Big Mission
description: Today: Ukrainian language schools have become a lifeline for children and parents in the diaspora. And the pandemic has created a national reading crisis, especially among younger children.

title: Starbucks Workers at 3 More Buffalo-Area Stores Vote to Unionize
description: Employees at three more Buffalo-area Starbucks have voted to unionize, bringing the total number of company-owned stores with a union to six, out of roughly 9,000 nationwide.

title: Modern Love Podcast: Beyond Girlfriend-Boyfriend
description: Three months into the coronavirus pandemic, Haili Blassingame was crafting an email to her boyfriend of five years, Malcolm, with the subject line My Terms. She wanted to break up.

title: Yoon Suk-yeol, South Korean Conservative Leader, Wins Presidency
description: SEOUL  A graft prosecutor turned opposition leader has won an extremely close presidential election in South Korea, reinstating conservatives to power with calls for a more confrontational stance against North Korea and a stronger alliance with the United States.

title: Metas head of youth product initiatives departs the company.
description: The vice president who led youth product initiatives at Meta, Facebooks parent company, is leaving after an internal restructuring, according to a company memo on Wednesday that was obtained by The New York Times.

title: A Bird Is Blamed as 10,000 Lose Power in New Orleans
description: In a city that knows all too well about the fragility of the power grid, it wasnt a hurricane or a heat wave that knocked out power to thousands of customers in New Orleans on Wednesday morning.

title: Most of the worlds new known virus cases this year emerged in the Americas, W.H.O. officials say.
description: The Americas continue to be disproportionately affected by the coronavirus pandemic, and it is too soon for countries in the region to relax public health measures, World Health Organization officials warned on Wednesday.

title: When Pigs Cry: Tool Decodes the Emotional Lives of Swine
description: At any given moment, there are as many as 12,500 Duroc hogs snorting around the barnyards of Imani Farms, a pig farm in southwestern Ontario.

title: Before Jussie Smollett Sentencing, His Supporters Ask for Mercy
description: Ahead of a sentencing hearing on Thursday, celebrities and racial justice advocates like Samuel L. Jackson and his wife, the actress LaTanya Richardson Jackson; the Rev. Jesse Jackson; and Derrick Johnson, the president of the N.A.A.C.P., have written letters pleading for leniency for Jussie Smollett, the actor convicted of falsely reporting that he was the victim of a racist and homophobic attack.

title: They Died by a Bridge in Ukraine. This Is Their Story.
description: KYIV, Ukraine  They met in high school but became a couple years later, after meeting again on a dance floor at a Ukrainian nightclub. Married in 2001, they lived in a bedroom community outside Kyiv, in an apartment with their two children and their dogs, Benz and Cake. She was an accountant and he was a computer programmer.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Indiscriminate Attacks in Mariupol
description: An apparent Russian strike on a hospital in Mariupol destroyed buildings including a hospital maternity ward, videos verified by The Times show. Here are the latest updates.

title: Black Panther Director Ryan Coogler Mistaken for Bank Robber in Atlanta
description: Bank of America has apologized to the director Ryan Coogler after he was assumed to be a bank robber and briefly handcuffed by the police while trying to withdraw money from a branch in Atlanta in January.

title: Cluster Munitions and Vacuum Bombs: Russian Invasion Revives an Old Debate
description: During an emergency meeting of the United Nations General Assembly last Wednesday, called in response to Russias invasion of Ukraine, the U.S. ambassador made an allegation about the weapons being used in the war.

title: Israels President Visits Turkey in Sign of Thawing Relations
description: JERUSALEM  President Isaac Herzog of Israel was received on Wednesday with pomp and ceremony by President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey during a state visit described by both sides as an effort to reset after years of testy and broken relations between the onetime regional allies.

title: Alex Ovechkin Skates Into Canadas Ukrainian Enclave as a Scorned Star
description: The hockey star Alex Ovechkin, center among Russian professional athletes in the publics anger over the war in Ukraine, played before the most unsympathetic crowd yet.

title: Alain Graillot, Influential Rhne Valley Winemaker, Dies at 77
description: Alain Graillot, who had never made a drop of wine when he arrived in the Crozes-Hermitage region of the Northern Rhne Valley in France in 1985 but became one of its leading producers, raising the reputation of its wines internationally, died on Friday at a hospital in Grenoble. He was 77.

title: Biden Nominates Roselyn Tso, of the Navajo Nation, to Run Indian Health Service
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden said Wednesday he would nominate Roselyn Tso to serve as director of the Indian Health Service, raising hopes of a fresh start for an agency that has drawn intense criticism over the years for failing to provide adequate care to tribal communities.

title: Cecilie Bahnsen Makes Her Paris Debut
description: In a white-walled studio in the Third Arrondissement of Paris two days before Cecilie Bahnsens fall 2022 runway presentation, the Danish designer is sitting on the concrete floor pawing a Pop It! toy with a co-workers toddler. The casting for the show  her namesake brands first in the French capital  is underway, and models are walking up and down the room, narrowly avoiding Bahnsen and the child, who is the daughter of the stylist Emelie Johansson. Then Bahnsen turns her attention to a tall woman with braids who has just entered the room. Shall we try her in the dress? she asks her team. They know which one she means: Theyve been working on it all morning.

title: Californias Move to Endemicity
description: Last month California became the first state in the U.S. to officially move from a pandemic approach to the virus toward an endemic one.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Subtle Shifts Raise Hopes for a Cease-fire in Ukraine
description: ISTANBUL  When President Vladimir V. Putin launched his invasion two weeks ago, he said a primary goal was the denazification of Ukraine. He referred to the Ukrainian government as a gang of drug addicts and neo-Nazis, making it clear that his aim was to topple it.

title: Polands Fraught Offer: Fighter Jets for Ukraine, but Only Through U.S. Hands
description: President Bidens commitment to keeping the United States from engaging in direct combat with Russian forces faced an unexpected test this week, when Poland surprised American officials by offering to turn over its collection of aging, Russian-made MIG fighters, for ultimate transfer to Ukraine.

title: Putins Getting Sanctioned, but Russias Getting Canceled
description: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it on Wednesdays.

title: After Ottawa, Trucker Convoy Near Washington Is a Low-Key Protest
description: HAGERSTOWN, Md.  When a convoy of trucks pulled out of Southern California last month, rolling toward the U.S. capital just days after the police in Canada cracked down on a legion of truckers occupying Ottawa, Washington braced for their arrival. The Department of Homeland Security issued a warning, and members of the National Guard were deployed, along with hundreds of city police officers.

title: Chernobyl Loses Power
description: Good evening. This is your Russia-Ukraine War Briefing, a weeknight guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict.

title: A Lion of the Civil Rights Era Is Still Preaching Optimism
description: ATLANTA  Andrew Young was beaten by white supremacists at a civil rights march in St. Augustine, Fla., in 1964. And he was close by when an assassins bullet fatally severed the spine of his friend and mentor, the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., in Memphis in 1968.

title: Fred Ferretti, Reporter Turned Writer on Food, Dies at 90
description: Fred Ferretti, who covered a panoply of breaking news events for New York City newspapers before becoming best known for his prolific writing on cuisine, comestibles and cooking for The New York Times and then Gourmet magazine, died on Monday at his home in Montclair, N.J. He was 90.

title: Charles E. Entenmann, Last of a Storied Baking Family, Dies at 92
description: Charles E. Entenmann, the last of three brothers who, with their mother, ran a Long Island bakery as it became one of the nations best-known producers of baked-goods, died on Feb. 24 in Hialeah, Fla. He was 92.

title: Real Madrid Rally Leaves P.S.G. Chasing Goals and Ghosts
description: MADRID  Karim Benzema could not have known, not consciously, what he was doing. It all happened too quickly, too chaotically, to be anything other than instinctual. He was standing on the edge of the Paris St.-Germain box. The ball slipped through a thicket of players. It was at his feet. He jabbed out a foot, a flash of movement, a tic, a twitch. And then everything melted around him.

title: Russia Bombards Ukraine Cities and Accuses U.S. of Economic War
description: Russian forces bombarded Ukrainian cities, prevented hundreds of thousands of civilians from escaping and destroyed a maternity hospital on Wednesday, while the Kremlin accused the United States of waging an economic war against Russia.

title: Damaged Chernobyl Nuclear Plant, Occupied by Russia, Loses Outside Power
description: Ukrainian government officials said Wednesday that damage by Russian forces had left the defunct Chernobyl nuclear power plant disconnected from outside electricity, leaving the site of the worst nuclear accident in history dependent on power from diesel generators and backup supplies.

title: M.L.B. Cancels Another Week of Games as Lockout Continues
description: Despite a marathon negotiating session that dragged from Tuesday morning until Wednesday night  with only a brief respite for sleep  Major League Baseball and the players union could not resolve a roadblock and reach a new labor deal ahead of a 6 p.m. deadline set by the league.

title: Evgeny Maslin, Russian General Who Secured Nuclear Arsenal, Dies at 84
description: Evgeny Maslin, a Russian general who, after the fall of the Soviet Union, set Cold War-era enmities aside to work with the United States in securing his countrys nuclear arsenal, a process that included the withdrawal of thousands of warheads from Ukraine, died on Feb. 26 at a hospital in Moscow. He was 84.

title: Cuomo? Oh, No!
description: So, people, how would you feel about an Andrew Cuomo comeback?

title: The Vaccine Mandate Remains at Some New York City Restaurants
description: On Tuesday night, about 20 people descended on Dame, in Greenwich Village, to protest the restaurants request that indoor diners provide proof of vaccination, a day after the city dropped its vaccine mandate.

title: Democrats Find Their Inflation Villains: Vladimir Putin and Big Oil
description: Democrats have a new strategy for dealing with the political impact of high gasoline prices: Blame it on Putin and Big Oil.

title: House Approves $13.6 Billion in Emergency Aid for Ukraine
description: WASHINGTON  The $1.5 trillion spending bill that passed the House on Wednesday was fueled in large part by bipartisan support for an emergency aid package for Ukraine, which would steer $13.6 billion in military and humanitarian assistance to the war-torn country under assault by Russia.

title: Walking With a Modern-Day Moses
description: The Rev. William Barber II is a large man, but bent. He walks with a cane, with his helper nearby, placing each step with deliberation to make sure that his footing is sure.

title: Guatemalan Women Face Up to 10 Years in Prison Under New Abortion Bill
description: Guatemalan lawmakers have passed a sweeping new bill mandating up to 10 years of jail time for women who obtain abortions, explicitly banning same-sex marriage and preventing schools from teaching about sexual diversity.

title: Uncertainty for Bidens Covid Plan After Aid Is Dropped From Spending Bill
description: WASHINGTON  Faced with Republican resistance after asking for billions of additional dollars to keep fighting the coronavirus, the Biden administration recently supplied Congress with a chart showing how much money it had left for testing, therapeutics and vaccines. It was filled with zeros.

title: What a Power Cutoff Could Mean for Chernobyls Nuclear Waste
description: The long-defunct Chernobyl plant in Ukraine is completely dependent on outside sources of electricity. So when that power is cut, as Ukrainian officials and the International Atomic Energy Agency say it has been by Russian troops, problems can result.

title: Corrections: March 10, 2022
description: An article on Monday about the upcoming trial of Lawrence V. Ray, who is accused of abusing students at Sarah Lawrence College, misidentified the dormitory where he lived on campus. It was Slonim Woods, not Slonim House.

title: House Passes $1.5 Trillion Spending Bill as Democrats Drop Covid Aid
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Wednesday passed a sprawling $1.5 trillion federal spending bill that includes a huge infusion of aid for war-torn Ukraine and money to keep the government funded through September, after jettisoning a package to fund President Bidens new Covid-19 response effort.

title: Judge Will Review Lawyers Emails Sought by Jan. 6 Panel
description: WASHINGTON  A federal judge said on Wednesday that he would review 111 emails that the lawyer John Eastman, an ally of former President Donald J. Trump, is attempting to keep from the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 Capitol attack, as the panel works to force the release of documents from lawyers involved in plans to overturn the 2020 election.

title: The Unseen Toll of a Warming World
description: More than two-thirds of Americans are anxious about climate change. They feel grief, anger and hopelessness. We spoke to people about the invisible scars of this growing crisis.

title: Help Wanted
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  UPDATE: I have added a comment about 47D in the Tricky Clues section. It is indeed tricky, but there is really only one answer.

title: Ontario will drop its indoor mask mandate weeks after trucker protests.
description: Officials in Ontario said on Wednesday that the province was dropping its universal mask mandate, weeks after truckers paralyzed Ottawa during their protests over coronavirus restrictions.

title: Customers Racial Slur Drew a Fatal Punch. The Sentence Is House Arrest.
description: A Black manager of a Dunkin shop in Tampa, Fla., who fatally punched a 77-year-old white customer last year after he repeatedly used a racial slur in addressing him was sentenced this week to two years of house arrest, prosecutors said.

title: Quotation of the Day: They Boil Snow for Water, With Death in the Air
description: If somebody dies in your family, just put the body outside, cover it, tie up the hands and the legs and leave it outside.

title: House Passes Bill to Bolster Protections for Women Facing Violence
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Wednesday voted to renew a lapsed law aimed at preventing domestic violence, sexual assault and stalking, approving the reauthorization of the Violence Against Women Act, a top priority of President Biden.

title: Here are the latest developments in the war on Ukraine.
description: The top diplomats from Ukraine and Russia failed to reach an agreement on Thursday to calm the fighting in Ukraine or even to ease the worsening humanitarian crisis, dashing hopes for a swift end to a two-week-old conflict that has killed hundreds and displaced millions.

title: Truckers gather near Washington to protest pandemic restrictions, without creating much disruption.
description: A caravan of semis, pickups and R.V.s that had driven across the United States to protest vaccine mandates and other Covid restrictions reached the capital region this week, but as the convoy circled the city, downtown Washington was business as usual.

title: A Coachs Homophobic Taunt Forces Him to Reconsider the Weight of Words
description: IRVINE, Calif.  Russell Turner was on top of the world three years ago when he eased into a chair in front of a microphone. Sure, the mens basketball team he was coaching, U.C. Irvine, had lost decisively to Oregon in the second round of the N.C.A.A. tournament. But the Anteaters had won a school-record 31 games that season, including their first tournament victory with an upset of Kansas State. There was also interest from Pac-12 and Mountain West Conference schools about hiring him.

title: Who Gets the First Chance to Sell Marijuana in New York?
description: Good morning. Its Thursday. Lets start with a question: Who can be a marijuana retailer in New York State? Well look at a wrinkle in the states plan that will vault some applicants to the front of the line. Well also look at an emotional outpouring among sweet tooths.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: The death, destruction and deprivation of war are mounting in Ukraine, from which an estimated two million people have fled seeking refuge. In the southern city of Mariupol, Russian commanders appear to be resorting to tactics used in Chechnya and Syria: flattening settlements with overwhelming and indiscriminate firepower.

title: How Vladimir Putin Lost Interest in the Present
description: Thanks to Vladimir Putins decision to invade Ukraine, Russia is now more isolated than it has ever been. The economy is under sanctions and international businesses are withdrawing.
