description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode with Masha Gessen. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: A Brief History of Bras in Crosswords
description: This is Clued In, a column that will give you insight into some of the New York Times Crossword clues and answers.

title: Government Site for Buying Savings Bonds Shows Its Age
description: As inflation has surged, many consumers have turned to the federal governments online TreasuryDirect system to buy inflation-indexed savings bonds. But the 20-year-old website may be showing its age.

title: Magic Could Happen
description: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif.  The countrys fastest high school distance runners were circling the track on a recent weeknight as Andrew Young dangled from the back of a speeding golf cart with his camera. Youngs twin sons, Lex and Leo, whose YouTube channel has nearly 13,000 followers, had enlisted their father to record their teams workout for posterity. The problem was they kept outrunning the golf cart.

title: Europes Trains Take Fighters to Ukraine, and Bring Back Refugees
description: ABOARD THE PRAGUE-PRZEMYSL TRAIN  On the 12th night of the war, on a platform at Pragues central train station, Vitali Slobodianiuk and Volodymyr Kotsyuba met for the first time.

title: The Latest News From Ukraine and Californias Response
description: Given the fast-changing situation in Ukraine and the mounting death toll, Ill be using todays newsletter to guide you through our coverage of the war as well as some stories with particular relevance to California readers.

title: A Tale of Survival Surfaces as an 1891 Shipwreck Is Found in Lake Superior
description: On May 4, 1891, as gale-force winds and waves raged on Lake Superior, the crew of a schooner barge named Atlanta abandoned ship as it sank. The six men and one woman, a cook, clung to their lifeboat for nine hours, fighting at its oars to guide it to the Michigan shore.

title: The Mafias View of The Godfather and the W.N.B.A. Star Detained in Russia: The Week in Narrated Articles
description: This weekend, listen to a collection of narrated articles from around The New York Times, read aloud by the reporters who wrote them.

title: Ask Wirecutter: Dog Walking in the Rain
description: Helping a reader with a reluctant pet.

title: Alec Baldwin Seeks to Avoid Liability in Fatal Rust Shooting
description: Alec Baldwin gave his most detailed account yet of fatally shooting a cinematographer on the set of the film Rust last year in an arbitration demand that his lawyers filed Friday against his fellow producers, claiming that his contract protected him from financial responsibility in her death and seeking coverage of his legal fees.

title: Wolves Returned to California. So Did Crazy Rumors.
description: Kent Laudon, a wolf biologist with the California Department of Fish and Wildlife, woke up one morning last year to a flurry of text messages from a rancher in the states northernmost county. He was asking about a post with wildly specific details spreading across Facebook that urged people to find a red truck that was transporting breeding wolves along Route 97 into Siskiyou County, Calif. Mr. Laudon was not surprised. This wasnt the first post of its kind, and it wouldnt be the last.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Good morning. Its getting toward ice-out season in some parts of the country, everything melting, making way for buds and flowers. Its not pretty. (In Vermont, they call it mud season. Maine, too. In Alaska, its breakup.) Everythings dirty, everythings wet. But that little softness in the air? Those pale green shoots in the wrecked grass at the park? They are promise of a lovely season to come, even if the act of writing those words will no doubt bring one last vicious snowstorm to my door.

title: Roman Abramovich and the End of Soccers Oligarch Era
description: There were, over the years, three stories that explained how Roman Abramovich washed ashore at Chelsea. Each one, now, serves as a kind of time capsule, a carbon-dated relic from a specific period, capturing in amber each stage of our understanding of what, precisely, soccer has become.

title: Five International Movies to Stream Now
description: A narrative feature by the Mexican comedian Gabriel Nuncio, This Is Not a Comedy is a strange and audacious concoction of kooky, funny and sad. Gabriel, playing himself, is a down-and-out stand-up comedian in Mexico City with dreams of producing his first screenplay, about a female astronaut who goes to Mars. The story seems inspired by Gabriels girlfriend, the eccentric Leyre (Cassandra Ciangherotti), who talks to plants and believes that aliens will arrive soon to take her away. Her bright-eyed curiosity cant seem to penetrate the cynical, broke-as-hell Gabriel, who is a repeat victim of Murphys law: In a running gag, he keeps forgetting his keys and has to have a locksmith break him into his apartment.

title: U.S. and Allies Move to Further Isolate Russia From Global Economy
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden and other Western leaders movedon Friday to further isolate Russia from the global trading system, saying they would strip the country of normal trade relations and take other steps to sever its links to the world economy in response to President Vladimir V. Putins invasion of Ukraine.

title: Disabled Chinese Fight for Equal Rights Despite Paralympic Glory
description: BEIJING  As Li Xiang strapped himself into a seat mounted atop a single ski and raced down the snowy slope, he reveled in the feeling of freedom that had become all too rare after a car accident required him to use a wheelchair as a child.

title: The Best of Late Night This Week
description: The late-night hosts devoted this week to Russias invasion of Ukraine and its wider effects, including skyrocketing gas prices in the United States. Heres what they had to say.

title: Hong Kongs overwhelmed hospitals are keeping the dead in wards with Covid patients.
description: Its an image that shocked many: bodies of the dead piled up next to Covid patients.

title: Whats in Our Queue? Gayle and More
description: I'm The Times's film editor. Here are five things I've been watching, reading and listening to.

title: My Cousin Vinny at 30: An Unlikely Oscar Winner
description: When the culture-clash courtroom comedy My Cousin Vinny landed in theaters on March 13, 1992, the critical response was mostly positive. The Timess Vincent Canby found it inventive and enjoyable, The Los Angeles Timess Peter Rainer called it often funny and The Hollywood Reporter deemed it a terrific variation on the fish-out-of-water/man-from-Mars story formula.

title: Bitcoin Was Made for This Moment. So Why Isnt It Booming?
description: For years, Bitcoin buffs who were questioned by skeptics about the value of the cryptocurrency would respond by saying: just wait.

title: A growing force in the climate movement: Moms
description: Many of you write to us and tell us about your feelings of powerlessness in the face of a global climate catastrophe. That sentiment is giving rise to a small but potentially potent force in the climate movement: moms, who have been catapulted into action by the hazards facing their children.

title: This Is Everyones Culture: Ukraines Architectural Treasures Face Destruction
description: Russias invasion of Ukraine brought searing images of human tragedy to witnesses around the world: thousands of civilians killed and injured; broken families, as mothers and children leave in search of refuge while fathers and other men stay behind to defend their country; and millions of refugees having already fled to neighboring countries, after just two weeks of war.

title: Legislators Find Way to Let U.C. Berkeley Increase Its Enrollment
description: Scrambling to short-circuit a court-ordered enrollment freeze at the University of California, Berkeley, state legislators on Friday unveiled a proposed change to a landmark environmental law that would let the university admit students at its previously planned level despite a lawsuit charging that its growth is polluting the city.

title: Oscars Rewind: When Rita Moreno Made History and Thanked No One
description: It was the night that cemented her place in history, and Rita Moreno almost skipped it.

title: Discoverys shareholders approve a merger with WarnerMedia.
description: Discoverys shareholders approved its coming merger with WarnerMedia on Friday, setting the stage for the two companies to combine in a matter of weeks.

title: Megan Thee Stallion and Dua Lipas Sultry Team-Up, and 10 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: Theory About U.S.-Funded Bioweapons Labs in Ukraine Is Unfounded
description: WASHINGTON  Prominent social media users and conservative voices have amplified a baseless theory promoted by Russian state media accusing the United States of funding biological weapons laboratories in Ukraine.

title: So Much Suffering in the Ukraine War
description: To the Editor:

title: Meet the East Coasts New Spider Friend
description: An invasive spider the size of a human palm could soon spread from Georgia throughout the East Coast.

title: Over Ukraine, Lumbering Turkish-Made Drones Are an Ominous Sign for Russia
description: Ukraines most sophisticated attack drone is about as stealthy as a crop duster: slow, low-flying and completely defenseless. So when the Russian invasion began, many experts expected the few drones that the Ukrainian forces managed to get off the ground would be shot down in hours.

title: Roman Abramovichs Fortune Bought Him Good Will, and Made Him a Target
description: As Russian troops massed near the border with Ukraine last month, the American ambassador to Israel received an appeal on behalf of Roman Abramovich, the most visible of the billionaires linked to President Vladimir V. Putin.

title: Wonking Out: Lies, Damned Lies and Gasoline Prices
description: Let me offer two theories about recent events. You tell me which you find more credible.

title: How We Verify Our Reporting on the Ukraine War
description: The Times has deployed dozens of reporters, photographers, videographers, audio journalists, writers and others to Ukraine and the countries bordering it to deliver real-time, independent, in-depth coverage of the conflict and its reverberations across the region. Times journalists are witnessing events on the ground as they unfold, reporting from battlefields, hospitals, improvised bomb shelters and contested cities.

title: Encanto May Be Accurate, but Can It Carry a Whole Country?
description: Encanto wasnt always set in Colombia.

title: Skewering the Anxious Young Things
description: LONDON  Seven years ago, Tom Stourton, 35, received a wedding invitation from two college friends. He was surprised, having drifted apart from the couple. But he attended the event, arriving hung over and sleep deprived from another party the night before.

title: The Weekender
description: Lao cooks celebrate their cuisine. Also in this edition: Al Pacino on 50 years of The Godfather and the Staten Island house where Black history lives.

title: Harris Tells Americans They Will Have to Pay More for Gas to Punish Russia
description: BUCHAREST  Vice President Kamala Harris said Friday that Americans will have to bear the burden of higher gas prices, but insisted that it was a cost worth paying to punish Russia for waging war on Ukraine.

title: Review: At Carnegie, Going Beyond the Rapid-Fire Vivaldi
description: Slow, serene, more floating than furious: A Vivaldi concert at Weill Recital Hall on Thursday began in decidedly un-Vivaldian style.

title: Harry Truman: The Everyman President
description: THE TRIALS OF HARRY S. TRUMANThe Extraordinary Presidency of an Ordinary Man, 1945-1953

title: These Garlic Noodles Are Magic
description: There is good weeknight cooking, and then there is great weeknight cooking: streamlined and smart, leveraging a few magic ingredients and a great technique to produce maximal flavor in minimal time. This week weve got a superb example in J. Kenji Lpez-Alts noodles, which are made with a garlic-butter sauce and a powerful umami triumvirate  oyster sauce, fish sauce and soy sauce. Its a recipe from his new book, The Wok, thats based on a dish from the San Francisco Vietnamese restaurant Thanh Long.

title: At Indian Wells, Ukrainian Tennis Stars Take Their Fight to the Court
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  The Ukrainian teenager Marta Kostyuk and the Belgian veteran Maryna Zanevska played for more than three hours in the sun and a swirling wind.

title: Manhattans Chinese Street Signs Are Disappearing
description: The arrival, expansion and disappearance of these bilingual street signs have traced the ebb and flow of Chinese immigration in New Yorks oldest Chinatown.

title: The Case for Induction Cooking
description: Robert Osborne grew anxious about dinner when his Brooklyn co-op board put the kibosh on a plan to move a gas line for his kitchen renovation. How could Mr. Osborne, a math teacher, cook his favorite dishes like skillet chicken with caramelized mushrooms and onions if he couldnt do it over the classic blue-orange blaze of a gas stove?

title: Love Letter: What an Illness Reveals
description: When he was 17 and in his second year of university, Chisom Peter Job collapsed while sweeping the floor. He was then diagnosed with coronary heart disease and had to move back home.

title: Yes, You Can Make Salmon on the Stovetop Without the Smell
description: Theres a line of shops on a tree-lined road in Dublin, with OBriens Wine in the center, a butcher and grocer on either side and a minimart at the far end. Taken together, they have most everything you would need to prepare meals. I know, because I dragged my daughter into each store and examined every aisle.

title: The global supply chains pandemic recovery is another casualty of Russias invasion of Ukraine.
description: Just as the global economy was on track to emerge from the coronavirus pandemic, Russias invasion of Ukraine and global sanctions against Moscow are rippling through logistics and supply chains, creating bottlenecks in the transport of goods and commodities and threatening fresh economic pain for countries and businesses near the conflict zone.

title: Saudi Blogger, Jailed and Flogged for Liberal Views, Is Freed From Prison
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A Saudi blogger who was flogged in a public square after expressing liberal views on the internet and whose case became a lightning rod for international criticism of the kingdoms intolerance for dissent was released from prison on Friday, his wife and son wrote on Twitter.

title: Russian Sieges of Ukrainian Cities Provoke Bitter Recollections for Syrians
description: Huda Khayti endured years of deprivation under siege by Syrian government forces in a rebel-held Damascus suburb. The thing she says she remembers most is the screams of her neighbors hungry children in the middle of the night.

title: Deshaun Watson Wont Face Criminal Charges in Houston Cases, Grand Jury Decides
description: HOUSTON  Deshaun Watson, the 26-year-old N.F.L. quarterback who has been accused by two dozen women of sexual misconduct during massage appointments, will not be criminally charged in Houston, a grand jury decided Friday.

title: Rusty Mae Moore, Transgender Educator and Activist, Dies at 80
description: Rusty Mae Moore, a transgender educator and activist who housed numerous transgender people in the 1990s and 2000s in her Brooklyn home, a de facto shelter that became known as Transy House, died on Feb. 23 at her home in Pine Hill, N.Y., in the Catskills. She was 80.

title: San Francisco Mayor Replaces Ousted School Board Members
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Three weeks after a decisive vote to recall members of the San Francisco school board, the citys mayor filled the vacated positions on Friday with a slate of parents who she said would tend to the urgent needs of the citys public school students.

title: Woodblock Prints and Hindu Gods at Asia Week New York
description: For more than a decade, before the pandemic, collectors and private dealers of Asian antiquities would converge in New York every spring for annual auctions at half a dozen houses including Bonhams, Christies and Sothebys. Many out-of-town dealers would set up shows of their own in hotels or partner galleries, while hometown galleries and museums mounted special exhibitions for the occasion.

title: Texas Court Halts Abuse Inquiries Into Parents of Transgender Children
description: HOUSTON  Investigations of parents with transgender children for possible child abuse were temporarily halted across Texas on Friday after a state court ruled that the policy, ordered last month by Gov. Greg Abbott, had been improperly adopted and violated the State Constitution.

title: Eventually We All Talk About Bruno
description: The most recent Disney megahit doesn't work like the usual Disney megahit.

title: A Musical Cure for Burnout
description: Songs by Tems, Nao and Jorja Smith remind us of the freedom in doing nothing.

title: Pink Siifu's Sonic Gumbo
description: The rapper and producer melts together deep traditions.

title: Kanye and Andr 3000 Are Lonely and in Limbo
description: Life of the Party is a song of grief  for West's mother, for his marriage, for dead rappers.

title: Bartees Strange Belongs to a Genre of One
description: This is Black music at peace with also being garage rock.

title: The Digital Antiheroes of 'Scam Rap'
description: Meet musics new outlaw: the online scammer.

title: Beach House on Making Music People Love to Cry To
description: They may not spend much time online, but they're incredibly popular there.

title: Is Doja Cat Uncancelable?
description: Her internet-bred frivolity leaves her freer than stars who obsess about maintaining a brand.

title: Dean Blunt and NoName Give Us (Some) Hope
description: Despite all that weve been through, they suggest, things can be ... all right?

title: Why Was Olivia Rodrigo Singing About Billy Joel?
description: The fascinating echoes from Boomer classics in a Gen-Z breakup hit.

title: The Women of Pop Are Imagining Life Without Fame
description: Plenty of musicians have moaned about their celebrity. Lorde's generation is recalibrating its approach.

title: A New, Stealthy Kind of Protest Music
description: Latin-American artists use images of fruits and flowers to expose the desecration of their homelands and sound out new futures.

title: How Labrinth Figured Out the Sound of Euphoria
description: The composer for HBOs teen drama says being in high school is gnarly as hell.

title: LRain Makes a Way Out of No Way
description: The artist Taja Cheek turns potent recordings from her life into even more potent music.

title: Taylor Swift and Tyler, the Creator Excavate Old Love
description: Their accounts of heartbreak are lengthy, detailed, purgative  and both touch on meeting the parents.

title: Earl Sweatshirt Doesn't Want to Be a God
description: One of raps more confounding artists uses his popularity to assert his humanity.

title: Turnstile on the Comfort of Hardcore Punk Shows
description: "Its kind of like when its raining and the weather is crazy outside, but it feels peaceful."

title: My Favorite Rap Songs Are All Fight and No Flight
description: Hip-hop's battle-ready swagger is thrilling and joyous. What sits behind it is more complex.

title: Adele and Abbas Songs of Experience
description: Some artists can turn the passing years  and their own public stories  into gravitas.

title: Mary J. Blige on the Beauty of Vulnerability
description: Thats the beauty of vulnerability, says the Queen of Hip-Hop Soul. It weeds out all the B.S.

title: Mitski Is More Than TikTok
description: Why does Gen Z love the pain in the singer's music?

title: The Delicious Misery of the Sad Banger
description: The case for songs of grief, anxiety and yearning  with upbeat tunes and infectious choruses.

title: The Songs That Get Us Through It
description: Featuring music from Mary J. Blige, Olivia Rodrigo, Beach House, Mitski and more.

title: With Trump in Her State, Haley Finds Some Political Distance (Gently)
description: WASHINGTON  Rumors were swirling in South Carolina early this February that Donald J. Trump would try to tear down a Republican congresswoman who had incurred his wrath.

title: Indexes, Soaring Imaginations and Other Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Fashion Week Style: Well Framed
description: Throughout fashion month, which concluded this week in Paris, the photographer Simbarashe Cha was out on the sidewalks searching for moments of personal style. Everywhere he went, eyewear in an endless variety of shapes and colors was on display. Here are some of the best frames he saw in four cities.

title: Bye Bye Iowa? Democrats to Debate Changes to Primary Calendar
description: For years, Democrats in Iowa and New Hampshire have battled criticism from others in the party who argued that the two states are not racially diverse enough to kick off the Democratic nomination process.

title: Disney Cant Hide From Politics
description: The Walt Disney Company has a big problem. It wants to be loved by everybody: Massachusetts liberals and Mississippi conservatives, Muslims in Saudi Arabia and atheists in China. It therefore prefers to minimize the number of times it takes stands on hot-button social issues.

title: Ukrainian Isnt Little Russian and Black English Isnt Broken
description: It was long ago common for Russians to regard Ukrainian as just a dialect of Russian. Little Russian, it was called. Writing for The Conversation this week, Florida International Universitys Phillip Carter said, If you ask some Russian nationalists, Ukrainian isnt a language at all, noting that in the 1863 Valuev Circular, Pyotr Valuev, Russias interior minister, decreed that a separate Ukrainian language did not exist.

title: President Zelensky Makes His Case for Ukraine to the Russian People
description: The thing about the videos from the war in Ukraine in 2014 was that there were very few war videos. It was, at least at first, a small-arms war. Fighting, when it erupted, happened on city streets. As soon as shots were fired, whoever was making the video would put away the phone and run.

title: Facebooks Parent Company Will Make Employees Do Their Own Laundry
description: The salad days of Facebooks lavish employee perks may be coming to an end.

title: The Price of Putins Belligerence
description: As his ruthless invasion continues, Vladimir Putin is trying to break Ukraine by demolishing its cities and brutalizing its people. Each day brings fresh horrors. A family killed while crossing a bridge to safety. Fathers and children touching hands and parting. A maternity hospital blasted into pieces in Mariupol, where roughly half a million people are under siege.

title: Ukraine War Gives Freight Firm a New Purpose: Im Fighting This Way
description: PORT READING, N.J.  A blue dot on a box means nonperishable food, ready for shipping. A red dot means first-aid items for hospitals still standing. A green dot means supplies for Ukrainians taking up arms: boots and kneepads, socks and gloves, thermal underwear and camouflage-patterned clothing.

title: U.S. Official Ends Sentence of Terrorist Who Was Tortured by C.I.A.
description: GUANTNAMO BAY, Cuba  A confessed courier for Al Qaeda whose tale of torture by the C.I.A. disgusted a U.S. military jury has completed his prison sentence, the Pentagon announced Friday. Now U.S. diplomats have to find a place for him to go.

title: We Live in a Different World Now: Dispatch From a Changed Germany
description: BERLIN  Nils Schmid, a member of Germanys Parliament and a foreign policy spokesman for the Social Democratic Party, was explaining to me what a minor role the military plays in his countrys politics.

title: Parents Relying on Ukraine Surrogates Desperately Seek Their Newborns
description: On the day Russia invaded Ukraine, Max and his wife drove from their home in Germany to Poland, and then crossed the border into Ukraine. With fear, they moved in the opposite direction of the long line of cars that intended to flee the country and that was snarling the roads for miles.

title: Britains High Court rules against a virus-related ban on a memorial vigil in London last year.
description: LONDON  The London police violated the human rights of four organizers in banning a March 2021 vigil for a woman who was killed by a police officer, the British High Court ruled on Friday. The police had cited coronavirus restrictions in banning the vigil.

title: Jussie Smollett, Once an Empire Star, Is Now in the Cook County Jail
description: It was an extraordinary ending to an unusual hearing.

title: The New Captain of the Endurance Shipwreck Is an Anemone
description: Huw Griffiths, a marine bio-geographer at the British Antarctic Survey, was eating pancakes when news broke that the wreck of the Endurance  the famed ship helmed by Ernest Shackleton that sank in an expedition in 1915  had been discovered.

title: A Ketamine Clinic Treads the Line Between Health Care and a Spa Day for Your Brain
description: The dcor of the Nushama Psychedelic Wellness Clinic was designed to look like bliss. It doesnt feel like a hospital or a clinic, but more like a journey, said Jay Godfrey, the former fashion designer who co-founded the space with Richard Meloff, a lawyer turned cannabis entrepreneur.

title: Burberrys Alternate Fashion Reality
description: LONDON  Call it London Fashion Lunchtime.

title: What Do I Do With All My Old Ties?
description: I imagine there is an ocean of men with the same problem: a tie rack full of ties and nowhere to wear them.

title: Crme de Cassis for the 21st Century
description: Eaten fresh, black currants are tart and herbaceous. They pop with an earthy funk, playing musty and acidic on the tongue. When crushed, macerated in high-proof neutral alcohol and sweetened with sugar, the astringent fruit becomes a rich, deep red liqueur with a languid pour. A specialty of the Burgundy region of France (cassis translates to black currant in French), crme de cassis has been produced commercially since 1841.

title: Stealth Omicron Is Stealthy No More: Whats Known About the BA.2 Variant
description: As the Omicron coronavirus surge subsides, researchers are keeping an eye on a highly transmissible subvariant known as BA.2. Many epidemiologists suspect that it may reverse the decline of cases in the United States, but doubt that it will cause a large new spike.

title: An Educator Read I Need a New Butt! to Children. Then He Was Fired.
description: It was Read Across America week, and the second graders in the Hinds County School District in Mississippi were waiting for an administrator to read to them.

title: The U.S. and the E.U., aiming to punish oligarchs, ban luxury exports to Russia.
description: Herms scarves, Harry Winston jewels, Feadship yachts, Mercedes cars, Cognac and Champagne  none of these public badges of achievement and culture will be available to oligarchs in Russia any more.

title: Court Declares Man Wrongfully Imprisoned for 45 Years
description: For decades, Isaiah Andrews has maintained his innocence in the 1974 murder of his wife, unaware that the key to his exoneration was buried in the archives of the Cleveland Division of Police.

title: Fall Back? Spring Ahead? How About Neither, Experts Say.
description: On Sunday, most people in the United States sprung their clocks forward by one hour, heralding the end of standard time (with its brighter mornings and darker evenings) and the beginning of daylight saving time.

title: A Rare Rainout Suspends Players Championship With Three Tied for Lead
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla.  This years Players Championship, a signature event of the PGA Tour, will take an extra day to complete after torrential rains on Friday in northern Florida suspended play for a second consecutive day. Golfers endured Fridays foul weather for only a few soggy hours at the T.P.C. Sawgrass golf course, one day after the first round was twice interrupted by rain delays and never completed.

title: 2 Dead After Driver Crashes Outside a Restaurant in Washington, D.C.
description: An older driver lost control of his vehicle and crashed into an outdoor seating area at a busy restaurant in Washington, D.C., at lunchtime on Friday, killing two women and leaving three other people with life-threatening injuries, the authorities said.

title: How People First Arrived in the Americas
description: Scholars have long believed that the first Americans arrived via land bridge some 13,000 years ago, when retreating glaciers created an inland corridor from Siberia. Jennifer Raff, an anthropological geneticist at the University of Kansas, tells a different story in Origin. According to Raff, the path to the Americas was coastal rather than inland, and what weve thought of as a bridge was a homeland inhabited for millenniums. Raff talks about the book on this weeks podcast.

title: Reclaiming time lost to Covid
description: Two years ago today, the World Health Organization declared the Covid-19 outbreak a global pandemic. A week before that, this newsletter was born. Since then, weve been on a journey together  braving waves of infections, experiencing sickness and loss, mastering the art of protecting ourselves, and continuously learning about a wily virus that seemed to surprise experts at every turn.

title: More Cities Bombarded
description: Good evening. This is your Russia-Ukraine War Briefing, a weeknight guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict.

title: How a Line of Russian Tanks Became an Inviting Target for Ukrainians
description: BROVARY, Ukraine  The column of Russian tanks rumbled along a main highway to the east of Kyiv, between two rows of houses in a small town  a vulnerable target.

title: Bruce Duffy, Hailed for His Ambitious First Novel, Dies at 70
description: Bruce Duffy, an ambitious, inventive writer whose debut novel, The World as I Found It  with its improbable leading man, the Austrian philosopher Ludwig Wittgenstein  received rapturous reviews but nevertheless failed to make him a lasting literary star, died on Feb. 10 in hospice care in Rockville, Md. He was 70.

title: U.S. Officials Say Superyacht Could be Putins
description: WASHINGTON  American officials are examining the ownership of a $700 million superyacht currently in a dry dock at an Italian seacoast town, and believe it could be associated with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, according to multiple people briefed on the information.

title: The far right complains after the search engine DuckDuckGo vows to limit Russian propaganda.
description: Far-right influencers have often encouraged people to use the small privacy-focused search engine DuckDuckGo instead of Google, saying that the giant search engine censored conservative ideas.

title: New Deltacron Variant Is Rare and Similar to Omicron, Experts Say
description: In recent days, scientists have reported that a hybrid of the Omicron and Delta coronavirus variants has been popping up in several countries in Europe. Heres what is known so far about the hybrid, which has picked up the Frankensteinian nicknames of Deltamicron or Deltacron.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Slowed on the Battlefield, Russia Widens Bombardment of Ukrainian Cities
description: The Russian military struck Ukrainian cities far from the main battle lines on Friday, pressing its strategy of bombing Ukraine into submission as the country plunged deeper into misery and privation more than two weeks into the war.

title: What to Know About Cryptocurrency and Taxes
description: Many people began buying crypto last year. They may not realize that, in some cases, they owe taxes on it.

title: For M.L.B. and the Union, a Relationship in Need of Repair
description: After the leadership of the Major League Baseball players union voted, 26-12, to approve a new labor deal on Thursday afternoon  following years of building mistrust of management and months of tense negotiating  M.L.B.s commissioner, Rob Manfred, picked up the phone.

title: Johnny Grier, N.F.L.s First Black Referee, Dies at 74
description: Johnny Grier, who became the first Black referee in the National Football League in 1988 and remained in that position, the top one in an officiating crew, for 16 years, died on Tuesday in Pasadena, Md. He was 74.

title: With a lot of the world yet to be vaccinated, protesters demand that the technology be shared.
description: Scattered demonstrations around the globe on Friday seeking to waive intellectual property rights for Covid vaccines punctuated the second anniversary of the World Health Organizations declaring the contagion a pandemic.

title: Republicans Sense an Opportunity in Nevadas Restless Latino Voters
description: When Senator Catherine Cortez Masto and her allies unveiled their first paid ads of the 2022 election cycle, the Nevada Democrats intended audience was clear: the states quarter-of-a-million Latino voters, a critical swing vote.

title: Until recently it was the stealth Omicron: Heres what we know about the BA.2 variant.
description: As the Omicron coronavirus surge subsides, researchers are keeping an eye on a highly transmissible subvariant known as BA.2. Although it doesnt appear to have the capacity to drive a large new wave of infections, the variant could potentially slow the current decline of Covid cases and make treatments more difficult.

title: Officer Who Killed MaKhia Bryant Will Not Face Charges
description: A grand jury has voted to bring no charges against the white police officer who shot and killed MaKhia Bryant, a 16-year-old Black girl, as she swung a knife at a woman during a raucous dispute last year in the front yard of her foster home in Ohio.

title: Afghan Embassy, Now Out of Money, Will Shut Down, U.S. Says
description: WASHINGTON  Without the backing of a recognized government or money to keep the lights on, Afghanistans embassy to the United States is shutting down, State Department officials said on Friday.

title: Brittney Griners Circle Turns to a Common Strategy: Silence
description: The detention of the W.N.B.A. star Brittney Griner in Russia on drug charges has left her supporters searching for a road map to a resolution in what could be an especially dangerous situation during the war in Ukraine.

title: Texas Supreme Court Shuts Down Final Challenge to Abortion Law
description: The Texas Supreme Court on Friday effectively shut down a federal challenge to the states novel and controversial ban on abortion after about six weeks of pregnancy, closing off what abortion rights advocates said was their last, narrow path to blocking the new law.

title: Are We Facing Nuclear War?
description: From The Daily newsletter: One big idea on the news, from the team that brings you The Daily podcast. You can sign up for the newsletter here.

title: M.L.B. Nears Deal With Another Streaming Service to Carry Some Games Exclusively
description: Ready to watch Major League Baseball before lunch? That will be an option if NBCUniversal completes a deal with the league to carry 18 games on its Peacock streaming service, some starting as early as 11:30 a.m. Eastern time and others just after noon, a person with knowledge of the deal said on Friday.

title: Fed officials meet to set rates, and new data on retail sales: the week ahead in business.
Queen Elizabeth is skipping next weeks Commonwealth Day service.
description: Buckingham Palace said on Friday that Queen Elizabeth II, who recently recovered from Covid-19, will not attend a Commonwealth Day service at Westminster Abbey next week  in what would have been her first major public engagement in weeks.

title: West Point Cadets Overdose During Spring Break in Florida, Officials Say
description: Several West Point cadets were among six young men on spring break who overdosed this week on what was believed to be cocaine laced with fentanyl at a rental home in Wilton Manors, Fla., officials said Friday.

title: Mentally Worn Out
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  It has been more than three and a half years since weve solved a Natan Last puzzle on a Saturday, which is far too long. This constructor is deservedly a favorite among solvers, and this puzzle shouldnt disappoint  a lot of nimble wordplay, interesting trivia and not a single dud or misstep that I can see.

title: Quotation of the Day: Putin Oligarch Finds Himself Pariah in Wests Playgrounds
description: The blood of the Ukrainian people is on their hands. They should hang their heads in shame.

title: Corrections: March 12, 2022
description: An article on Friday about a collective bargaining agreement between Major League Baseballs club owners and its players union misstated the amount that the M.L.B.s luxury tax threshold will increase to in 2026. It is $244 million, not $242 million.

title: China dismisses two mayors and Shanghai closes schools as an outbreak spreads further.
description: BEIJING  Two mayors have been dismissed in northeastern China, and Shanghai has closed its school system and shifted to online instruction, as a coronavirus outbreak in mainland China gathers speed.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: SATURDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Shaming Apple and Texting Musk, a Ukraine Minister Uses Novel War Tactics
description: After war began last month, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine turned to Mykhailo Fedorov, a vice prime minister, for a key role.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Standing Out in the Crowds
description: Theres just nothing like photographing people in Paris, but over the past two years the scene has changed and evolved as the fashion shows stumbled along through each pandemic wave. Now, the streets are full again. Camera technology allows novices to take exceptional photos. Most notably, the level of style from fans outside the shows has been so elevated, it would be foolish for the photographers who usually train their lenses on fashion editors and influencers who wear heritage brands to ignore them. It brings a renewed excitement, reminiscent of the old days when someone might be discovered shopping at a mall  a thrill like the kind one experiences when unearthing a gem at a thrift store.

title: India Accidentally Fires a Missile at Pakistan. Calm Ensues.
description: JAIPUR, India  One nuclear-armed state fired a cruise missile at another nuclear-armed state this week. They were not at war, and it did not start one.

title: American Voters Now View Ukraine as Favorably as France, Germany and Japan
description: In a new  survey, 81 percent of Americans say Ukraine is either friendly or an ally, a figure that rivals or  exceeds that of many longtime U.S. allies.

title: The Land of the Ice and Snow
description: EXTREME NORTH: A Cultural HistoryBy Bernd Brunner Translated by Jefferson Chase

title: How Much Real Money Can You Make From Virtual Art?
description: Late on a Friday last spring, Izzy Pollak decided to buy two Bored Ape NFTs, which  as a reminder for the many people thinking, Yeah, but I still dont know what an NFT is  means he bought unique, digital images (in this case, of apes).

title: Saving Each Others Lives, Quite Literally
description: Brian Gari has a background in theater, but nothing could prepare him for the drama of his first years of marriage to Jeanne Cathcart.

title: First Comes Marriage, Then Comes Love
description: Marriage isnt a word  its a sentence. That famous quip is especially true in romance novels, where marriage is often a starting point rather than an end goal. This month we look at three new romances in which a wedding is not a bow tied on at the finish, but a tether pulling characters through the plot.

title: For Italys Sled Hockey Team, This One Means More
description: BEIJING  There are no medals for fifth place in the Paralympic sled hockey tournament. But judging by the scenes of exultation and joy on the ice at Chinas National Indoor Stadium on Friday, the Italian national team will cope just fine without them.

title: That Russian Business Youre Boycotting Isnt Actually Russian
description: They poured the liquid out  blueberry-flavored, orange-flavored and the original, face-puckering unflavored version  tweeting #DumpRussianVodka and, at gay bars across the country, made do with Absolut and soda instead.

title: Hundreds of Planes Are Stranded in Russia. They May Never Be Recovered.
description: Hope has faded quickly for a handful of Western companies eager to recover planes leased to airlines in Russia, with the authorities there intent on keeping foreign-registered aircraft within the country and President Vladimir V. Putin openly discussing nationalizing the assets of foreign businesses.

title: An Author Wrote About Her Sisters Murder. It Led to a Breakthrough.
description: It took Cristina Rivera Garza 30 years to write the story of her sisters unsolved murder.

title: House Democrats Push Biden to Build a Better Midterm Message
description: WASHINGTON  After offering her customary lavish praise of President Biden, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi got to the business at hand at a White House meeting last month on the midterm elections.

title: After 2 Years of Pandemic Life, Turn Toward Normalcy Is a Shake-Up
description: It was two years ago that the World Health Organization declared Covid-19 a pandemic, and after nearly one million deaths across the United States, the virus is far from gone. Rates of new infections, while improving, are still higher now than the beginning of last summer.

title: What It Was Like to Work for Russian State Television
description: For eight years, Lee Camp hosted a weekly show on RT America that aimed to satirize American politics, finding punchlines in subjects like sanctions against Afghanistan and student debt forgiveness. That ended unceremoniously on March 3, a week after Russian airstrikes began in Ukraine, when the Russian-state-funded network suddenly shut down.

title: Chaos of War in Ukraine Could Fuel New Covid Surge, Doctors Say
description: LVIV, Ukraine  The last thing on anybodys mind these days in Ukraine seems to be Covid.

title: Russian Scientists Face Isolation Following Invasion of Ukraine
description: One of the glories of international scientific collaborations, besides sharing costs and brainpower, is the building of personal relationships that transcend individual cultures, traditions and political regimes.

title: Maluma, Fashion Chameleon
description: A few days after a January snowstorm, Juan Luis Londoo Arias, the 28-year-old Colombian pop star who performs as Maluma, entered a Midtown Manhattan office building near the Macys flagship store. Wearing a tie-dyed, periwinkle, denim jacket and pants, hed somehow managed to keep his chunky-soled white leather Prada boots pristine, despite the rivers of slush on the sidewalks. Like magic, shortly after he showed up, the sun broke through the overcast sky.

title: He Spent Decades Protecting Buffalo. A Microscopic Invader Threatens That Work.
description: BLACKFOOT, S.D.  On the ice-glazed banks of the Missouri River, coyotes chewed through the hide of a buffalo that had recently died from disease. In a corral up the hill, more than 20 orphaned buffalo calves crowded together in the cold with no mother to protect them. Down in the pasture, a few animals stood apart from the others, coughing violently, clouds of their breath hanging in the winter air.

title: Pandemic Fears Give Way to a Rush for Bomb Shelters
description: BAGNOLO SAN VITO, Italy  Across a footbridge from a busy shopping outlet surrounded by verdant fields in northern Italy, workers in a nondescript warehouse are preparing for a nuclear attack, its radioactive fallout and the end of the world as we know it.

title: Arctic Security Concerns Resurface in Canadas Territories Amid Russian War
description: For the better part of next week, residents in Canadas Northwest Territories may see a greater military presence and aircraft whirring about.

title: Bilingual Signs Are Disappearing in Chinatown. We Investigated.
description: Aaron Reiss, a freelance multimedia journalist covering immigrant communities in New York City, and Denise Lu, a graphics editor at The Times, teamed up for an article that examines bilingual signs in Manhattans Chinatown. Together, they shared how the article came together.

title: Here are the latest developments in Ukraine.
description: LVIV, Ukraine  The war in Ukraine expanded significantly on Sunday as Russian warplanes struck a military base near the Polish border where foreign fighters including Americans were being trained. At least nine people were killed and 57 wounded, officials said.

title: Pandemic Playlists
description: To get through the pandemic, the writer Hanif Abdurraqib has relied on sad bangers: songs whose lyrics of grief, anxiety, yearning or some other mild or great darkness are washed over with an upbeat tune, or a chorus so infectious that it can weave its way into your brain without your brain taking stock of whatever emotional damage it carries with it. Bruce Springsteens Hungry Heart is a sad banger, he writes in The Times Magazines annual music issue. So are Robyns Dancing on My Own and Lil Nas Xs Lost in the Citadel.

title: Yarn, Introspection and Pancakes
description: Hello, readers.

title: The Bond King Traces the Arc of a Pioneering Investor
description: The DealBook newsletter delves into a single topic or theme every weekend, providing reporting and analysis that offers a better understanding of an important issue in business. If you dont already receive the daily newsletter, sign up here.

title: Parents, What Would Make Your Lives Better?
description: On this day two years ago, I remember gripping my younger daughters hand especially tight on the way to her preschool. We were almost at the front door when I felt my phone buzz with an email from the school: A parent in the community had been exposed to the coronavirus, and out of an abundance of caution we recommend that you keep your child home if possible.

title: McDonalds Ice Cream Woes Have Inspired Memes, Mockery and Now, a Federal Lawsuit
description: Its a perennial lament of McDonalds loyalists: Why are the ice cream machines always down?

title: Donald Pinkel, Who Developed a Cure for Childhood Leukemia, Dies at 95
description: Dr. Donald Pinkel, a pediatrician who, starting in the early 1960s, developed an aggressive treatment for childhood leukemia that transformed the disease from a virtual death sentence to one that almost every patient survives, died on Wednesday at his home in San Luis Obispo, Calif. He was 95.

title: The Pros and Cons of Buying a Tenant-Occupied Apartment
description: Q: We are considering buying a tenant-occupied apartment in a condo. The tenant has lived there since August 2019, and the market-rate lease will expire in four months. The sellers agent said they could deliver the apartment vacant, but that wed have more leverage on the sale price if we kept the tenant. We visited the apartment and the tenant has kept everything clean and in good shape. Were not in a rush to occupy the apartment and it would be nice to have some income in the interim. What are the pitfalls we should be aware of before we make this decision?

title: How to Watch the Critics Choice Awards 2022: Date, Time and Streaming
description: Follow live coverage of the 2022 Critics Choice Awards.

title: Booster shot data from New York City shows major disparities by race and neighborhood.
description: Much like the rest of the United States, New York City has struggled to convince some groups of residents to get a booster shot of the coronavirus vaccine. But new data released by the city on Wednesday shows wide disparities among who in the city is getting a third dose.

title: France Cares About Green Causes, but Not Its Green Party
description: MONTPELLIER, France  Yannick Jadot, the candidate for the French Green Party in Aprils presidential elections, walked through a small cheering crowd to a podium topped with banners featuring his face, as speakers blasted a version of What a Wonderful World by the punk rock singer Joey Ramone. The candidate bobbed his head to the rhythm.

title: On Pacific Islands Covid Once Spared, an Outbreak Accentuates Inequality
description: NOUMA, New Caledonia  Festooned with hibiscus flowers and woven palm fronds, scores of guests gathered for a celebration during New Caledonias wedding season. The aroma of grilled fish and yams bathed in coconut milk wafted over the revelers on the island of Lifou, population 10,000.

title: Zelensky Answers Hamlet
description: WASHINGTON  For actors, it is the most gripping, feared line ever written.

title: One More Census Takeaway: The End of an Era of Counting the Nation?
description: WASHINGTON  Beyond the reports of undercounts and overcounts in population totals, there is another takeaway from the post-mortem of 2020 census data issued on Thursday: This could be the last census of its kind.

title: Mask mandates were extended for U.S. transit, but dropped in many other settings: The week in Covid news.
description: In an aggressive step toward normalcy, public school students in New York City returned to mask-optional classrooms on Monday for the first time since the start of the pandemic.

title: The Comfort of Sports During Difficult Times
description: As I sit writing in a quiet part of my apartment building, I can see two televisions. One is playing CNN. Jake Tapper is asking a reporter how victims of the opioid crisis confronted the Sackler family, which owns Purdue Pharma, at a hearing on Thursday. Earlier, the network focused on images from the war in Ukraine  bloodied victims of bombings, bodies buried in mass graves, buildings on fire.

title: Can Public Health Be Saved?
description: This article is part of Times Opinions reflection on the two-year mark of the Covid pandemic. Read more in a note from Alexandra Sifferlin, Opinions health and science editor, in our Opinion Today newsletter.

title: How to Wean Europe Off Russian Gas as Swiftly as Possible
description: Russias unprovoked invasion of Ukraine has pressed Europe to fundamentally rethink how it keeps its lights on and its industries powered. Steps that would have sounded crazy only a few weeks ago  burning more coal or scaling up government intervention in energy markets  are now urgently needed to stop financing Vladimir Putins war.

title: Just How Liberal Is California? The Answer Matters to Democrats Everywhere.
description: LOS ANGELES  California is awash in money, with so many billions in surplus revenue that the state cannot enact programs fast enough. Democrats hold veto-proof majorities in the Legislature, and Gov. Gavin Newsom has a $25 million campaign war chest to fend off any token opposition in his re-election bid.

title: Cancel Culture in 1832 Sounded Pretty Fierce
description: One important reason to study history as a social critic or political observer is that it can help you see continuities across time, the ways that certain social and political dynamics recapitulate themselves in various contexts and circumstances. Even as every particular instance of the thing is different, the fact of continuity helps an observer see that the phenomenon does not simply erupt out of the ether, but is the product of larger forces in the society.

title: Ukraine War Ushers In New Era for U.S. Abroad
description: WASHINGTON  The war in Ukraine has prompted the biggest rethinking of American foreign policy since the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks, infusing the United States with a new sense of mission and changing its strategic calculus with allies and adversaries alike.

title: The Villages in Florida: Shangri-La or Shameful?
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. to Send Arms to Ukraine, as Russia Intensifies Campaign of Destruction
description: LVIV, Ukraine  Russian forces stepped up their campaign of bombardments aimed at devastating Ukraines cities and towns on Saturday, as the White House announced it was sending an additional $200 million in arms and equipment to help Ukraine, defying Moscow.

title: Bringing Outsider Artists In
description: Sophia Cosmadopoulos and Anna Schechter, who run Summertime Gallery in East Williamsburg, Brooklyn, dont write the press materials for their exhibitions. And when the women organize a show, they exercise little influence over the artwork on display, or even how the gallery looks. They are, by design, hands-off gallerists.

title: Meet the Underdog of Senior Care
description: Felicia Biteranta was struggling when, five years ago, she enrolled in a PACE program operated by Lutheran Senior Life in Jersey City, N.J.

title: With Bombings and a Funeral, the War Arrives in Ukraines West
description: LUTSK, Ukraine  Men in camouflage, hardened by battle, sniffled as a Ukrainian Orthodox choir sang the haunting funeral mass. One man put his arm around another as tears welled in his eyes.

title: The White House approves $200 million in arms and equipment for Ukraine.
description: WASHINGTON  The White House has approved an additional $200 million in arms and equipment for Ukraine, administration officials said on Saturday, responding to urgent requests from President Volodymyr Zelensky for more aid to stave off the Russian invasion.

title: In a Kyiv Basement, 19 Surrogate Babies Are Trapped by War but Kept Alive by Nannies
description: KYIV, Ukraine  Down a dusty stairwell, hidden from the shelling that has become the grim background noise of Ukraines capital, Ludmila Yashenko fusses with the babies. There are 19 of them, sleeping or cooing in neatly arranged cribs, fed regularly from tubs of baby formula.

title: After Days of Uncertainty, a Ukrainian Soldier Is Laid to Rest
description: Senior Lt. Vasyl Vyshyvanyi was killed by Russian forces on March 3, but heavy combat kept the military from evacuating his body. Six days later, he was buried in his home village outside Lviv.

title: Street battles hit a Kyiv suburb, some of the closest fighting to the capital yet.
description: IRPIN, Ukraine  In Irpin, just outside the capital city of Kyiv, Ukrainian and Russian soldiers were fighting a street-by-street battle on Saturday, turning what was a leafy suburb just two weeks ago into a suburban battleground.

title: Bobbie Nelson, Longtime Pianist for Brother Willie, Dies at 91
description: Bobbie Nelson, the longtime piano player in her brother Willies band and a grounding influence in his life and music, died on Thursday in Austin, Texas. She was 91.

title: How Ukrainian Paralympians Pushed Through Fear and Worry
description: BEIJING  With heavy hearts and unimaginable worry, athletes from the Ukrainian national Paralympic team arrived in China two weeks ago, seeking to win medals and draw attention to the plight of their country through their athletic achievement.

title: The Ukraine War and the Retro-Future
description: Long before Vladimir Putins invasion of Ukraine, his aggressions were often met by the accusation  leveled by John Kerry and Angela Merkel, among others  that hes a 19th-century figure in a 21st-century world. Its a line that seemed intended to judge Putin guilty not just of wickedness but of anachronism, which is somehow more confounding to the modern mind.

title: Floridas Dont Say Gay Bill Will Hurt Teens Like Me
description: Last October, I attended a high school Halloween party. A group of guys from my school surrounded me and shouted homophobic slurs. One even threatened me with physical violence. When I broke down crying in class the next day, my teacher comforted me. She told me that she had gone through something similar when she was my age.

title: The Russians Might Have Expected a Warm Welcome. Instead the Mayor Labeled Them Occupiers.
description: LVIV, Ukraine  Ivan Fyodorov, as his name suggests, is an ethnic Russian in a southern Ukrainian city where Russian is commonly spoken and where cultural and familial ties to the motherland run deep.

title: Ron Miles, Understated Master of Jazz Cornet, Is Dead at 58
description: Ron Miles, whose gleaming, generously understated cornet playing made him one of the most rewarding bandleaders in contemporary jazz, if also one of its most easily overlooked, died on Tuesday at his home in Denver. He was 58.

title: Police ID Suspect in Stabbing of MoMA Employees
description: A man who was denied entry to the Museum of Modern Art because his membership had been revoked jumped over the reception desk and stabbed two employees on Saturday afternoon, the police said.

title: Scherzers Message as Camp Opens: Its Over. Lets Just Play Baseball.
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Max Scherzer, the Mets new star pitcher, was perhaps the most prominent face of the players unions fight with Major League Baseballs club owners over a new labor contract.

title: Body Language
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  This is Christina Iverson and Katie Hales second clever Sunday collaboration; theyve gone from audible to visual wordplay with this grid, whose theme reminds me of a large, organized variety puzzle.

title: Yuriko, Keeper of Martha Grahams Flame, Is Dead at 102
description: Yuriko Kikuchi, who under the single name Yuriko was a leading dancer in Martha Grahams company from the 1940s to 1967 and then a keeper of Grahams flame through her demanding teaching and outstanding revivals of early Graham works, died on Tuesday in Manhattan. She was 102.

title: Traci Braxton, Television Personality and Singer, Dies at 50
description: Traci Braxton, a television personality and singer, died on Saturday. She was 50.

title: L.S.U. Mens Basketball Coach Fired After N.C.A.A. Alleges Violations
description: Louisiana State abruptly fired mens basketball coach Will Wade on Saturday, less than a week after the school received a notice of allegations from the N.C.A.A. that accused Wade of five major rules violations, including making cash payments and job offers to help lure a recruit to the school.

title: Oregon and Washington State, known for cautious Covid strategies, lift their statewide mask mandates.
description: Oregon and Washington State, two of the most successful states at limiting deaths and infections during the pandemic, lifted their statewide mask mandates on Saturday, making masks optional in most settings.

title: Saudi Arabia Puts 81 to Death, Despite Promises to Curb Executions
description: CAIRO  Saudi Arabia said on Saturday that it had put 81 people to death in what was the kingdoms largest mass execution in years, despite recent promises to curb its use of the death penalty.

title: South Korea exceeds 380,000 new cases in a day shortly after its presidential election.
description: South Korea reported another record for daily new coronavirus cases over the weekend, reaching 383,665 known cases on Saturday, according to the government  a fresh reminder that cases have yet to peak during the current surge that is being fueled by the highly contagious Omicron variant. Public health experts had projected at the end of February that new cases would reach 350,000 a day by the end of March, and it was unclear whether predictions for a peak had been reset.

title: Quotation of the Day: Two Years Into the Pandemic, Relief, Frustration and Fear as Mandates Ease
description: Everyone is worn out. Everyone is exhausted. I am as well. But we lost 1,400 Americans yesterday to Covid and well probably lost another 1,400 today. And I dont think anything has happened that suggests to me that vaccine mandates and mask mandates should be lifted.

title: Corrections: March 13, 2022
description: An article on Page 18 this weekend about the movie The Godfather and its similarities to the real life mafia misspells the name of the author of The Five Families: The Rise, Decline, and Resurgence of Americas Most Powerful Mafia Empires. He is Selwyn Raab, not Rabb. The article also describes incorrectly a recording of two mobsters in 2005. The recordings were made in person, not over the telephone.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: SUNDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Being on Leave Means Not Sending That 2 A.M. Email
description: Send questions about the office, money, careers and work-life balance to workfriend@nytimes.com. Include your name and location or request to remain anonymous. Letters may be edited.

title: As a Crisis Hotline Grows, So Do Fears It Wont Be Ready
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: These Weed Sellers Arent Waiting for Permits: Like a Dream Come True
description: Wanting to invest in himself and be free of bosses, Terrence Gorham started selling customized T-shirts, hoodies and backpacks from a folding table in Washington Square Park a year ago. Like any good vendor, he noticed late last year when other tables started featuring something new: weed. Soon, he was offering pre-rolled joints and eighth-of-an-ounce pouches alongside his Think Rich clothing line.

title: The Driver Motioned for My Friend to Hand Over the Phone
description: Dear Diary:

title: When You Think About Investing, Dont Think About the News
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Generation X Volunteers Want to Help You, and One Day Themselves, Age at Home
description: At 88, Susan McWhinney-Morse is a member of the Silent Generation, so named by some demographers partly for its heads-down, sleeves-up approach to hard work. She fits the industrious profile. But silent she is not.

title: Naomi Osaka Brought to Tears by Heckler at Indian Wells
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  Crying on court after being heckled by a spectator, Naomi Osaka was knocked out of the BNP Paribas Open in the second round on Saturday.

title: The Week in Business: Economic Sanctions Take a Toll
description: More than two million people have fled Ukraine in the last two weeks as Russias invasion of the country claimed thousands of lives and cut off access to water and electricity in some cities. In response to the humanitarian crisis, more than 300 companies have withdrawn at least some operations in Russia, according to a list kept by the Yale School of Management. Retail companies closed stores, fast-food restaurants paused operations and business services firms removed Russian partners from their umbrella networks. But some of these measures have drawbacks. They could hurt Russian civilians or other countries that are allied against Russia. President Vladimir V. Putin accused the United States of waging an economic war against Russia on Wednesday and the next day told officials in a televised meeting that the assets of U.S. companies that pull out of Russia should be nationalized.

title: On S.N.L., President Biden Seeks Help From TikTok Influencers
description: It was reported in The Washington Post this week that the Biden administration has been meeting with popular video creators from the social network TikTok and briefing them on the war in Ukraine, an unconventional move that could help the White House in its information battle  or get it made fun of relentlessly.

title: The Year That Transformed Dickens (or Did It?)
description: THE TURNING POINT1851  A Year That Changed Charles Dickens and the WorldBy Robert Douglas-Fairhurst

title: Homes That Sold for Around $775,000
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: Eastern Orthodox Leaders Are Outspoken on Ukraine War. Except One.
description: Last week, more than a dozen religious and political leaders sat on the dais of the Ukrainian Orthodox Cathedral of Saint Volodymyr on the Upper West Side, listening to solemn prayers and fiery speeches denouncing Russia and extolling Ukrainian resistance to the invasion that began two weeks earlier.

title: Talking Chaos, or Plotting a Conspiracy? The Debate in the Whitmer Kidnapping Trial.
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich.  Few people took the Covid-19 lockdown restrictions that swept the world in the spring of 2020 harder than the far-right extremist Adam Fox.

title: U.K. vs. Oligarchs: The Gloves Are Now Off
description: LONDON  On Friday, the day after Britain blacklisted seven prominent Russian oligarchs, residents of the wealthy London borough of Kensington and Chelsea rolled a washing machine overflowing with fake pound notes in front of a multimillion-dollar townhouse belonging to the family of the president of Azerbaijan.

title: Californias Ambitious High-Speed Rail at a Crossroads
description: FRESNO, Calif.  On an average day, 1,000 workers head to dozens of construction sites spread over 119 miles across Californias vast Central Valley.

title: First Amendment Scholars Want to See the Media Lose These Cases
description: The lawyers and First Amendment scholars who have made it their lifes work to defend the well-established but newly threatened constitutional protections for journalists dont usually root for the media to lose in court.

title: Search Intensifies for Gunman in Homeless Shootings in 2 Cities
description: The police in New York City and Washington and federal investigators intensified their search on Monday for a gunman who they said had been targeting homeless people sleeping outdoors and had shot at least five men, two of them fatally.

title: Missiles Fired From Iran Hit Near U.S. Consulate Site in Iraq
description: At least a dozen missiles fired from Iran struck near a United States Consulate compound being built outside the city of Erbil in the Kurdish region of Iraq early Sunday, according to Iraqi and U.S. officials.

title: Think of Groundhogs: For Life Advice From a Grade Schooler, Press 2
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: States Want to Ban Abortions Beyond Their Borders. Heres What Pro-Choice States Can Do.
description: A recently introduced Missouri provision would allow private citizens to sue anyone who helps a Missouri resident get an abortion in another state.

title: Its Time to Offer Russia an Offramp. China Can Help With That.
description: Casualties are mounting in Ukraine. Bombs continue to fall. More than 2 million refugees have fled the fighting.

title: Government Is Flailing, in Part Because Liberals Hobbled It
description: Theres a strange story unfolding in Berkeley, Calif., right now. That may present as a tautology, but bear with me. This one provides a window into a problem that endangers us all.

title: The Sunday Read: What Rashida Tlaib Represents
description: Rozina Ali profiles Rashida Tlaib, the 45-year-old second-term congresswoman from Detroit, who has risen from adverse circumstances to play a significant role in American politics, most notably bringing greater awareness to the ongoing conflict over Palestine.

title: The War Next Door
description: USTRZYKI DOLNE, Poland  Polish people know the pain of being invaded. This is what an opera singer told me as she handed out hot stew to Ukrainian refugees in a tent near the mountainous border between Ukraine and Poland on a chilly night in early March. She had planned to go skiing. She came here instead.

title: Poems in a Time of Crisis
description: Two weeks into the war, the Russians are still menacing my birth city, Odessa, in southwestern Ukraine. It sits on high bluffs above the Black Sea, its famous steps leading from the water to a square.

title: N.C.A.A. Mens Tournament Seedings Set as Spectacle Returns to March
description: When the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament pairings were announced Sunday night, it served as one big welcome mat for the sport.

title: The base attacked in western Ukraine has been a hub for foreign militaries.
description: The base outside Lviv that was attacked by Russian forces early on Sunday was a key link between Ukraines armed forces and Western militaries before the war  and has become an important logistics hub and training center for foreign fighters since Russias invasion began.

title: Europe Awakens
description: Europes assertive response to Russias invasion of Ukraine has presented a possibility that was hard to imagine a month ago: the European Union as a superpower that can alter the global order, promoting liberal democratic values worldwide.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | March 14, 2022
description: 1. After looking closely at the image above (or at the full-size image), think about these three questions:

title: A Rock Wall Let the United States Flex Its Hockey Might
description: BEIJING  The tears started flowing from Jen Lees eyes the moment the horn sounded to signal that the United States had beaten Canada, 5-0, to win its fourth consecutive gold medal in Paralympic sled hockey.

title: Jane Campion Wins Directors Guild Award for The Power of the Dog
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.  The Directors Guild of America awarded its top prize for feature-film directing on Saturday night to Jane Campion for The Power of the Dog, making her the third woman ever to receive the award. Her victory also represents the first time in DGA history that women have won that award in back-to-back years, after Chlo Zhao took the prize in 2021 for Nomadland.

title: N.C.A.A. Womens Tournament Set With South Carolina at No. 1 Overall Seed
description: A 68-team field of stalwarts, potential spoilers and national tournament newcomers will play for the N.C.A.A. championship in Division I womens basketball.

title: Unsuk Chin on the Violin Concerto She Swore Shed Never Write
description: The 21st century has been a strong one for violin concertos. Think Jennifer Higdon, whose neo-Romantic showpiece for Hilary Hahn won the Pulitzer Prize in 2010. And Esa-Pekka Salonen, Thomas Ads, Harrison Birtwistle, Jrg Widmann (twice) and John Adams (the same).

title: Critics Choice 2022: Complete List of Winners
description: The 27th Annual Critics Choice Awards, which gives out honors to both films and TV shows, were held on Sunday night.

title: Brent Renaud, an American journalist, is killed in Ukraine.
description: Brent Renaud, an award-winning American filmmaker and journalist, was killed in Ukraine on Sunday while reporting in a suburb of the capital, Kyiv, according to Ukraines Interior Ministry.

title: Trinity Churchs Conductor Put on Leave Amid Investigation
description: Trinity Wall Street, one of New Yorks wealthiest and most powerful churches, said on Saturday that it was placing its high-profile director of music on leave as it investigates an allegation of sexual misconduct against him.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. How are you doing? Im moved to ask that question every couple of months because I think its important to acknowledge that you might not be doing well at all. We are two years into the pandemic and some two weeks into the war in Ukraine. Theres heartbreak everywhere, and there are times for all of us when it seems too much to bear.

title: With cases still rising in Hong Kong, 300,000 people are isolating at home, officials say.
description: HONG KONG  As many as 300,000 Hong Kong residents are isolating at home, the citys leader said on Sunday, as officials scrambled to build mass quarantine centers and treatment facilities to house patients with even the mildest Covid-19 symptoms.

title: How Readers Around the World Are Praying for Ukraine
description: Each morning over the past few weeks, I have woken up to the chirpy voices of my children. Ive gotten them off to school and their daily activities, poured a cup of green tea and sat down to pray for Ukraine.

title: How Likely Is Another Civil War?
description: To the Editor:

title: Players to Watch in the Womens N.C.A.A. Tournament
description: Between their highlight reel plays and hard-to-believe statistics, Aliyah Boston, Caitlin Clark and Paige Bueckers have become familiar not only to womens college basketball fans but to many people with only a passing interest in sports.

title: Players to Watch in the N.C.A.A. Mens Tournament
description: When the N.C.A.A. mens tournament starts with the play-in games on Tuesday and the round of 64 on Thursday, some of the most noticeable players to watch will come from schools like Bryant, South Dakota State and Seton Hall  not just from the top seeds.

title: Tova Borgnine, Cosmetics Maven and QVC Star, Dies at 80
description: Tova Borgnine, the Norwegian-born cosmetics entrepreneur and home-shopping star who was known not just for selling beauty products but also for being the fifth wife and most enduring relationship of the actor Ernest Borgnine, died on Feb. 26 at her home in Chester County, Pa. She was 80.

title: Brent Renaud, Crusading Filmmaker, Is Killed at 50
description: Brent Renaud, who with his brother, Craig, formed a Peabody Award-winning documentary film team that drew attention to human suffering, often working with major news organizations like The New York Times, was fatally shot in Irpin, a suburb of Kyiv, on Sunday. He was 50.

title: The Key to a $4 Billion Fraud Case: A Banker Who Says He Lied a Lot
description: It seemed a facetious question, one intended to provoke the star witness: Do you think you are good at lying?

title: Approval of travel insurance claims slows as the Omicron wave subsides.
description: Before the pandemic, Lauren Mack, 44, a writer based in New York City, did not routinely purchase travel insurance, she wrote in an email. Covid-19 convinced her otherwise, and of six trips taken since the onset of the pandemic, she has had to file claims for three  twice for weather delays and once because her travel companion tested positive for the virus. Two are still under review, and the first took nearly two months from claim to reimbursement.

title: On a Stage 5,000 Miles Away, He Sings for His Family in Ukraine
description: Sometimes lately, when he hasnt been rehearsing Verdi or Tchaikovsky at the Metropolitan Opera, or practicing Italian with a diction coach on Zoom, the bass-baritone Vladyslav Buialskyi takes out his phone and sends a one-word text message: Mama.

title: Met Museum Names a Mexico City Architect to Lead a New Major Project
description: The Mexican architect Frida Escobedo, who at 38 was the youngest architect to design the Serpentine Pavilion in 2018, has been selected to design the Metropolitan Museum of Arts new $500 million Modern and contemporary art wing, the museum announced on Sunday.

title: At Chelsea, Nervous First Steps Into an Uncertain Future
description: LONDON  For the Chelsea fans who headed to Stamford Bridge for the teams first home game since its world crumbled last week, signs of the clubs new, diminished circumstances were clear to see.

title: Time is running out for civilians in Mariupol, Red Cross warns.
description: LVIV, Ukraine  At least 2,187 people in the coastal city of Mariupol have died since the start of the war, Ukraines government said Sunday, as the International Committee of the Red Cross warned that time was running out for hundreds of thousands of civilians still trapped in the besieged city.

title: Unvaccinated M.L.B. players will not be allowed to play in Canada.
description: Major League Baseball players who are not vaccinated against the coronavirus will not be allowed to enter Canada to play games against the Toronto Blue Jays because of the countrys restrictions, and they will not be paid while the team is abroad as part of the sports new labor agreement.

title: Renny Cushing, Relentless Foe of Death Penalty, Dies at 69
description: Robert R. Cushing Sr., a retired elementary-school teacher, was watching a basketball game on television at his home in New Hampshire in 1988 when he heard a knock at the door. When he answered it, a man fired two blasts from a sawed-off shotgun, killing him in front of his wife, and fled.

title: Afghan Aviators Hide as Taliban Urge Them to Return to Duty
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Last year, the three Afghan aviators served in the elite Special Mission Wing of the Afghan Air Force. Trained by Americans to fight the Taliban from the air, they were some of the Afghan militarys most elite troops.

title: Brent Renaud, an American filmmaker killed in Ukraine, captured the human toll of war.
description: When Brent Renaud, an award-winning American filmmaker and journalist, was killed in Ukraine on Sunday, he was there to do what he had done throughout his career: bear witness to the worlds most dangerous stories.

title: Review: A Song of Songs Makes a Sacrament of Remembrance
description: A few sheets of colored tissue paper, weighted down by a trinket to keep them from fluttering off. This is what audience members find on their seats upon arrival at A Song of Songs, Agnes Borinskys new theater piece inspired by the biblical Song of Songs, and its something of a puzzle. What to do with them?

title: Biden Administration Fights in Court to Uphold Some Trump-Era Immigration Policies
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden promised to unravel the moral and national shame of the immigration policies enacted by President Donald J. Trump. But that was hardly the position Mr. Bidens lawyers took in a federal courtroom earlier this year.

title: Seven Steps to Destroy a Democracy
description: We are now living through a fully fledged attack on nonwhite power in this country, as conservative white people assert their authority. Until now, the effects of this crusade were somewhat unclear. Data needed to be collected after new conservative laws and policies had gone into effect.

title: The Skiing Aigners Are a Nation Unto Themselves
description: YANQING, China  The 2022 Winter Paralympics ended Sunday with China winning, by far, the most medals, 61, followed by the undaunted Ukrainian team and Canada.

title: Ukraines energy minister says power has been restored at Chernobyl nuclear plant.
description: Ukraines energy minister said Sunday that power supply has been restored at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant, which Russian troops have occupied since late February.

title: Ukrainian refugees find shelter, and a hearty welcome for their pets, in Romania.
description: SUCEAVA, Romania  Viktor and Rachel Borovic were very grateful to be given a hot meal at a church in Suceava after they crossed from Ukraine into Romania, but they had to turn down the offer of a bed for the night.
